<L>6438<pc>364<k1>वारिक<k2>वारिक
{%Vārika%}¦ (IE 8-8; EI 30, 32), a class of officials; the priest
<div n="lb">or superintendent of a temple like a {%Pāṇḍā%} of modern times;
<div n="lb">cf. {%Deva-vārika%} (EI 27), superintendent of a temple; also cf.
<div n="lb">Tamil {%Vāriyan%} (SITI), a supervisor.
<div n="P">Cf. {%Mahāgandhakuṭī-vārika%} (LL), ‘superintendent of the
<div n="lb">great {%gandhakūṭī%} (q. v.).’ The official designation {%Pāṭvāri%} seems
<div n="lb">to be derived from {%Paṭṭavārika.%}
<div n="P">{%Cf.%} Tamil {%vāriyaṃ%} (SITI), an executive committee;
<div n="lb">appointment as a member of that body; an office of supervision;
<div n="lb">cf. {%śrībhaṇḍāra-vāriyam%} (EI 33). See {%SII,%} Vol. III, p. 151, note.
<div n="P">{%Cf. bārika%} (EI 5, 19), a village official; one entrusted
<div n="lb">with putting an official seal or stamp to a document; cf.
<div n="lb">{%bārika-jana-hasta.%}

{%Vāy-kkeḻvi, Vāy-kkeḻviyār%}¦ (SITI), an officer who received
<div n="lb">the king's oral orders; an officer in attendance on the king,
<div n="lb">acting as the intermediary between the king and his subjects;
<div n="lb">the king's order. Cf. {%Ājñapti.%}
<LEND>

<L>6507<pc>368<k1>वायु<k2>वायु
{%vāyu%}¦ (IE 7-1-2), ‘fortynine’.

<L>6508<pc>368<k1>वेद<k2>वेद
{%veda%}¦ (IE 7-1-2), ‘four’ (the four Vedas being {%Ṛk, Yajus,%}
<div n="lb">{%Sāman%} and {%Atharvan%}); rarely used to indicate ‘three’ (cf. {%trayī%})
<div n="lb">in late records (IE 7-1-2; IA 9).
<LEND>

<div n="lb">was such a school at Kāñcīpuram. Cf. {%śālā, khaṇḍikā, Ṛgveda-%}
<div n="lb">{%khaṇḍikā.%}

<L>6618<pc>374<k1>विंशोपक<k2>विंशोपक
{%viṃśopaka%}¦ (IE 8-6, 8-8; EI 29, 30; CII 4), a copper coin
<div n="lb">which was one-twentieth of the standard silver coin in value; cf.
<div n="lb">{%Viśālapriya-viṃśopaka%} (IE 8-8); {%Varāhakīya-viṃśopaka%} (EI 1); {%Vṛṣa-%}

<div n="lb">measure of land equal to 20 {%vasas%} [in Gujarat].

<div n="lb">(1/16) of a {%haṇa (paṇa);%} but (1/20) of the standard coin in value

<div n="lb">the fraction (1/10); gold equal in weight to one grain of rice;

<L>6661<pc>377<k1>विषवृत्ति<k2>विष-वृत्ति
{%viṣa-vṛtti%}¦ (SITI), same as {%viṣahara-bhoga.%}

<L>6662<pc>377<k1>विषय<k2>विषय
{%viṣaya%}¦ (EI 8-4), a district; often a kingdom or terri-
<div n="lb">tory; sometimes a {%viṣaya%} was included in a {%maṇḍala;%} but, in
<div n="lb">some cases, a {%maṇḍala%} was included in a {%viṣaya;%} at times {%maṇḍala%}
<div n="lb">and {%viṣaya%} were synonymous.
<div n="P">({%IE%} 8-5; EI 30; CII 3, 4; BL; SITI), a district; cf.
<div n="lb">{%viṣaya-suṅka%} (EI 24), the tax of a district; {%Viṣaya-vyavahārin,%}
<div n="lb">officer in the service of a district.
<div n="P">({%ASLV%}), same as {%nirvṛtti%} or {%koṭṭam;%} an administrative
<div n="lb">division.
<div n="P">({%IE%} 8-4; CII 4), sometimes used in a wider sense to indi-
<div n="lb">cate ‘a country’.
<div n="P">({%IE%} 7-1-2), ‘five’.
<LEND>

{%yava,%}¦ one-fifteenth of a {%māṣa%} ({%JNSI,%} Vol. XVI, p. 45);
<div n="lb">equal to 2 {%dhānyamāṣas%} ({%ibid.,%} p. 48); (1/3) of a {%rati.%}
<LEND>

<L>6823<pc>385<k1>यावदेकपात्र<k2>यावदेक-पात्र
{%Yāvadeka-pātra%}¦ ({%Ep. Ind.,%} Vol. XXVII, p. 122, text lines
<div n="lb">4-5), official designation. See {%Pātra.%}
<LEND>

<L>6824<pc>385<k1>यवन<k2>यवन
{%Yavana%}¦ (EI 26; CII 1), originally, an Ionian Greek; then,
<div n="lb">people of Greek nationality; ultimately, any foreigner.
<LEND>

<L>6825<pc>385<k1>यवुग<k2>यवुग
{%Yavuga%}¦ (EI 14), royal title of foreign origin.
<LEND>

<L>6826<pc>385<k1>योग<k2>योग
{%yoga%}¦ (CII 4), meditation; a philosophical system.
[Page-386+ 40]
<div n="P">({%EI%} 18), a council or corporation.
<div n="P">({%CII%} 3; IA 17), addition of the longitudes of the sun and
<div n="lb">moon; an astrological element.
<div n="P">{%Cf. yogaṃ yuñjantām,%} ‘let them obtain the association [of
<div n="lb">the gods]’. See {%Ep. Ind.,%} Vol. XXXI, p. 208. Cf. {%yuj.%}
<LEND>

<L>6827<pc>386<k1>योगक्षेम<k2>योग-क्षेम
{%yoga-kṣema%}¦ (IA 7; LP), death; cf. {%jāta-yoga-kṣema,%} dead.
<LEND>

<L>6828<pc>386<k1>योगपट्ट<k2>योग-पट्ट
{%yoga-paṭṭa%}¦ (EI 14), band used by the ascetics to keep their
<div n="lb">limbs in a position of rigidity.
<LEND>

<L>6829<pc>386<k1>योगपट्टक<k2>योग-पट्टक
{%yoga-paṭṭaka,%}¦ cf. {%joga-vaṭṭigĕ%} (IA 14), explained as ‘a
<div n="lb">garment worn during contemplation’; same as {%yoga-paṭṭa%} (q. v.).
<LEND>

<L>6830<pc>386<k1>योगपीठ<k2>योग-पीठ
{%yoga-pīṭha%}¦ (IA 10), a holy place where an ascetic obtained
<div n="lb">perfection ({%siddhi%}) by his austerities; also called {%siddha-pīṭha.%}
<LEND>

<L>6831<pc>386<k1>योगिन्<k2>योगिन्
{%yogin,%}¦ cf. {%yogīndra%} (SII 1) a [Jain] ascetic.
<LEND>

<L>6832<pc>386<k1>योजन<k2>योजन
{%yojana%}¦ (CII 1, 4), name of a measure of distance; a dis-
<div n="lb">tance of about nine miles.
<LEND>

<L>6833<pc>386<k1>योनिपट्ट<k2>योनि-पट्ट
{%yoni-paṭṭa,%}¦ same as {%gaurī-paṭṭa;%} see {%pīṭha.%}

<L>6834<pc>386<k1>युद्धित<k2>युद्धित
{%yuddhita,%}¦ ‘onewho died fighting’ ({%Ep. Ind.,%} XXXI, p. 324).

<L>6835<pc>386<k1>युध्य<k2>युध्य
{%yudhya%}¦ (EI 4), name of a sacrifice.

<L>6836<pc>386<k1>युग<k2>युग
{%yuga%}¦ (IE 7-1-2), ‘four’; rarely, 2 or 12.

{%yugā%}¦ (CII 4), a voucher.

<L>6839<pc>386<k1>युगादि<k2>युग्-आदि

<div n="lb">of the commencement of a {%yuga;%} e. g. Vaiśākha-sudi 3, regarded
<div n="lb">as the commencement of the Kṛta-yuga.

<L>6846<pc>386<k1>युज्<k2>युज्
{%yuj%}¦ (CII 1), cf. {%vṛddhir=yujyatām,%} ‘should devote them-
<div n="lb">selves for an increase’; {%śāśvataṃ samayam=[etad]=yuñjyuḥ,%} ‘they
<div n="lb">may strive for this at all times’. Cf. {%yoga.%}
<LEND>

<L>6847<pc>386<k1>युक्त<k2>युक्त
{%Yukta%}¦ (EI 8-3; HD), an officer in general; also an offi-
<div n="lb">cial designation ({%CII,%} Vol. 1, p. 4); the word used in Rock
<div n="lb">Edict III of Aśoka is explained by some scholars as the designa-
<div n="lb">tion of a class of officers, although there also the word may be
<div n="lb">understood in the sense of ‘an officer’; but it is an official desig-
[Page-387+ 22]
<div n="lb">nation in passages like {%yukta-niyukta-vāsāvak-ādhikārika%} ({%Ep. Ind.,%}
<div n="lb">Vol. XXI, p. 144) where it may be the same as {%Āyuktaka.%}
<div n="P">{%Cf. Yuktaka, Āyukta,%} etc.
<LEND>

<L>6848<pc>387<k1>युक्तक<k2>युक्तक
{%Yuktaka%}¦ (IE 8-3; HD), same as {%Yukta, Āyukta%} or {%Āyuktaka.%}
<div n="lb">See {%Ep. Ind.,%} Vol. VII, pp. 26, 39-40.
<LEND>

<L>6849<pc>387<k1>यूप<k2>यूप
{%yūpa%}¦ (EI 2, 24, 33), sacrificial pillar; it was sometimes
<div n="lb">made of stone and inscribed.
<LEND>

<L>6850<pc>387<k1>यूथी<k2>यूथी
{%yūthī,%}¦ also spelt {%yūtī%} (IA 17), generally written as {%yūti%}
<div n="lb">or {%pūti;%} cf. {%tṛṇa-yūti%} (or {%pūti%}) {%-gocara-paryanta,%} ‘as far as grass
<div n="lb">land and pasture land’.
<LEND>

<L>6851<pc>387<k1>यूति<k2>यूति
{%yūti,%}¦ cf. {%sva-sīmā-tṛṇa-yūti-gocara-paryanta%} (IE 8-5); also
<div n="lb">written as {%pūti;%} a word of uncertain import; probably, ‘[land]
<div n="lb">reserved [for growing grass, etc.]’ Cf. {%go-yūti, tṛṇa-yūti, kāṣṭha%}
<div n="lb">{%-yūti.%}
<LEND>

<L>6852<pc>387<k1>युवमहाराज<k2>युवमहाराज
{%Yuvamahārāja%}¦ (IE 8-2; EI 3, 20, 24), modification of
<div n="lb">{%Yuvarāja;%} designation of the heir-apparent or crown-prince;
<div n="lb">same as {%Mahāyuvarāja.%}
<LEND>

<L>6853<pc>387<k1>युवराज<k2>युवराज
{%Yuvarāja%}¦ (IE 8-2, CII 3, 4; HD; ASLV), designation of
<div n="lb">the heir-apparent or crown-prince. See {%Arthaśāstra,%} I. 12 (men-
<div n="lb">tioned among the 18 {%tīrthas%}); cf. {%CII,%} Vol. II, Part i, p. 40.
<div n="P">{%Cf.%} Tamil {%Tuvarāśaṉ%} (EI 4), also {%Duvarāja.%}
<div n="P">{%Cf. Mahāyuvarāja%} (EI 32), same as {%Yuvamahārāja%} (q. v.).
<LEND>
;
; APPENDIX I
;
<H>PRIVILEGES ATTACHED TO FREE HOLDINGS
<H>APPENDIX I
[Page-388+ 36]

<L>6854<pc>388<k1>अभटच्छात्रप्रावेश्य<k2>अ-भट-च्छात्र-प्रावेश्य
{%a-bhaṭa-cchātra-prāveśya%}¦ (EI 26, 27; CII 3), same as {%a-cāṭa-%}
<div n="lb">{%bhaṭa-prāveśya, Chātra%} (literally, ‘the umbrella-bearer’) being used
<div n="lb">for {%Cāṭa%} probably meaning ‘the leader of a group of {%Bhaṭas%} (i. e.
<div n="lb">{%Pāiks%} or {%Piādas%})’; same as {%a-prāveśya,%} etc.
<LEND>

<L>6855<pc>388<k1>अभटप्रावेश्य<k2>अ-भट-प्रावेश्य
{%a-bhaṭa-prāveśya,%}¦ same as {%a-prāveśya,%} etc. Cf. Prakrit {%a-bhaḍa-%}
<div n="lb">{%papesa%} ({%Select Inscriptions,%} p. 435).
<LEND>

<L>6856<pc>388<k1>अभृतप्रवेश्य<k2>अ-भृत-प्रवेश्य
{%a-bhṛta-praveśya%}¦ (EI 24), same as {%a-bhaṭa-prāveśya;%} cf. {%a-%}
<div n="lb">{%prāveśya,%} etc.
<LEND>

<L>6857<pc>388<k1>अभ्यन्तरसिद्धि<k2>अभ्यन्तर-सिद्धि
{%abhyantara-siddhi%}¦ (EI 22), same as {%abhyantara-siddhyā, abhyan-%}
<div n="lb">{%tara-siddhika;%} refers to internal revenue income or taxes to be
<div n="lb">paid to local authorities; cf. {%sa-bāhy-ābhyantar-ādāya.%}
<LEND>

<L>6858<pc>388<k1>अभ्यन्तरसिद्धिक<k2>अभ्यन्तर-सिद्धिक
{%abhyantara-siddhika,%}¦ (EI 20) same as {%abhyantara-siddhi.%}
<LEND>

<L>6859<pc>388<k1>अभ्यन्तरसिद्धिसहित<k2>अभ्यन्तर-सिद्धि-सहित
{%abhyantara-siddhi-sahita%}¦ (EI 27), same as {%abhyantara-siddhi,%} etc.
<LEND>

<L>6860<pc>388<k1>अभ्यन्तरसिद्ध्या<k2>अभ्यन्तर-सिद्ध्या
{%abhyantara-siddhyā,%}¦ ‘together with the internal income or
<div n="lb">taxes to be paid to the local authorities’; cf. {%abhyantara-siddhika%}
<div n="lb">and {%sa-bāhy-ābhyantar-ādāya.%} Cf. {%Ind. Ep.,%} p. 398.
<LEND>

<L>6861<pc>388<k1>आचन्द्रादित्यकालीय<k2>आ-चन्द्र्-आदित्य-कालीय
{%ā-candr-āditya-kālīya%}¦ (IE), ‘to be enjoyed as long as the moon
<div n="lb">and sun endure’ (i. e. permanently); epithet of the gift land.
<LEND>

<L>6862<pc>388<k1>आचन्द्रार्कक्षितिसमकालम्<k2>आ-चन्द्र्-आर्क-क्षिति-सम-कालम्
{%ā-candr-ārka-kṣiti-sama-kālam,%}¦ ‘as long as the moon, the sun
<div n="lb">and the earth exist’ (i. e. permanently).
<LEND>

<L>6863<pc>388<k1>आचन्द्रार्क<k2>आ-चन्द्र्-आर्क
{%ā-candr-ārka%}¦ (IE; SITI), ‘in perpetuity.’
<LEND>

<L>6864<pc>388<k1>आचन्द्रार्कार्णवक्षितिस्थितिसमकालीन<k2>आ-चन्द्र्-आर्क्-आर्णव-क्षिति-स्थिति-सम-कालीन
{%ā-candr-ārk-ārṇava-kṣiti-sthiti-sama-kālīna%}¦ (EI), ‘to last as
<div n="lb">long as the moon, the sun, the seas and the earth endure’
<div n="lb">(i. e. permanently); cf. {%Ep. Ind.,%} Vol. XXXII, p. 134.
<LEND>

<L>6865<pc>388<k1>आचन्द्रार्कार्णवक्षितिसरित्पर्वतसमकालीन<k2>आ-चन्द्र्-आर्क्-आर्णव-क्षिति-सरित्-पर्वत-सम-कालीन
{%ā-candr-ārk-ārṇava-kṣiti-sarit-parvata-sama-kālīna,%}¦ ‘to be en-
<div n="lb">joyed as long as the moon, the sun, the seas, the earth, the rivers
<div n="lb">and hills exist (i. e. permanently)’; cf. {%Ep. Ind.,%} Vol. XXXIII,
<div n="lb">p. 134.
<LEND>

<L>6866<pc>388<k1>आचन्द्रतारकम्<k2>आ-चन्द्र-तारकम्
{%ā-candra-tārakam,%}¦ ‘as long as the moon and stars endure’
<div n="lb">({%Ep. Ind.,%} Vol. XXXV, p. 149, text line 12), i. e. permanently.
<LEND>

<L>6867<pc>388<k1>अचारासनचर्माङ्गार<k2>अ-चार्-आसन-चर्म्-आङ्गार
{%a-cār-āsana-carm-āṅgāra%}¦ (IE; EI 27), refers to the freedom of
<div n="lb">the gift village from the obligation to supply conveyance, accom-
<div n="lb">modation, hide (i. e. hide-seats) and charcoal free of charges
<div n="lb">to the touring officers on their visit. The word {%cāra%} meaning
[Page-389+ 40]
<div n="lb">‘passage or conveyance’ is sometimes substituted by {%pāra%} meaning
<div n="lb">‘ferrying’.
<LEND>

<L>6868<pc>389<k1>अचारसिद्धिक<k2>अ-चार-सिद्धिक
{%a-cāra-siddhika%}¦ (EI 26), explained by some as ‘without
<div n="lb">grazing right for the royal cattle’. Cf. {%a-vāra-siddhika.%}
<LEND>

<L>6869<pc>389<k1>अचर्माङ्गारक<k2>अ-चर्म्-आङ्गारक
{%a-carm-āṅgāraka,%}¦ refers to the freedom of the gift village
<div n="lb">from the obligation to supply hide-seats and charcoal to the king
<div n="lb">or landlord on occasions or to the touring royal officers on their
<div n="lb">visit. Cf. Prakrit {%a-camm-aṅgālaka%} ({%Select Inscriptions,%} p. 409).
<LEND>

<L>6870<pc>389<k1>अचाटभटगोचर<k2>अ-चाट-भट-गोचर
{%a-cāṭa-bhaṭa-gocara%}¦ (EI 22), same as {%a-cāṭa-bhaṭa-praveśa,%} etc.
<LEND>

<L>6871<pc>389<k1>अचाटभटप्रवेश<k2>अ-चाट-भट-प्रवेश
{%a-cāṭa-bhaṭa-praveśa%}¦ (EI 27, 29; CII 3), refers to the free-
<div n="lb">dom of the gift village from the entry of the {%Cāṭas%} (leaders of
<div n="lb">groups of {%Pāiks%} and {%Piādas%}) and the {%Bhaṭas%} ({%Pāiks%} and {%Piādas%});
<div n="lb">cf. {%a-bhaṭa-praveśa, a-bhaṭa-chātra-prāveśya, a-bhṛta-praveśa,%} etc.
<LEND>

<L>6872<pc>389<k1>अचाटभटप्रावेश्य<k2>अ-चाट-भट-प्रावेश्य
{%a-cāṭa-bhaṭa-prāveśya%}¦ (CII 3, 4), same as {%a-cāṭa-bhaṭa-pra-%}
<div n="lb">{%veśa;%} refers to the freedom of the gift land from being entered
<div n="lb">by the {%Bhaṭas%} (the king's {%Pāiks%} and {%Piādas%}) and the {%Cāḷa%} (the
<div n="lb">leader of a group of {%Pāiks%} and {%Piādas%}); cf. {%Chātra%} in place of {%Cāṭa%}
<div n="lb">in {%a-bhaṭa-cchātra-prāveśya;%} also {%Bhṛta%} for {%Bhaṭa%} in {%a-bhṛta-praveśya.%}
<LEND>

<L>6873<pc>389<k1>अचट्टभट्टप्रवेश<k2>अ-चट्ट-भट्ट-प्रवेश
{%a-caṭṭa-bhaṭṭa-praveśa%}¦ (EI 27), same as {%a-cāṭa-bhaṭa-praveśa.%}
<LEND>

<L>6874<pc>389<k1>अचुल्लककूरखट्वाग्रहण<k2>अ-चुल्लक-कूर-खट्वा-ग्रहण
{%a-cullaka-kūra-khaṭvā-grahaṇa,%}¦ similar to {%a-kūra-chullaka-%}
<div n="lb">{%vināśi-khaṭv-āvāsa,%} etc. See {%Ep. Ind.,%} Vol. XXXI, p. 5.
<LEND>

<L>6875<pc>389<k1>अदुग्धदधिग्रहण<k2>अ-दुग्ध-दधि-ग्रहण
{%a-dugdha-dadhi-grahaṇa,%}¦ refers to the freedom of the gift
<div n="lb">village from the obligation of supplying milk and curs to the
<div n="lb">king or landlord on occasions or to the touring officials on their
<div n="lb">visit. Cf. Prakrit {%a-dudha-dadhi-gahaṇa%} ({%Select Inscriptions,%} p. 439).
<LEND>

<L>6876<pc>389<k1>अहरीतकशाकपुष्पग्रहण<k2>अ-हरीतक-शाक-पुष्प-ग्रहण
{%a-harītaka-śāka-puṣpa-grahaṇa,%}¦ refers to the freedom of the
<div n="lb">gift land from the supply of myrobalan, vegetables and flowers
<div n="lb">to the king or landlord on occasions or to the touring officers
<div n="lb">on their visit. Cf. Prakrit {%a-haritaka-sāka-pupha-gahaṇa%} ({%Select%}
<div n="lb">{%Inscriptions,%} p. 439).
<LEND>

<L>6877<pc>389<k1>अहरीतपर्णशाकपुष्पफलदुग्धदधिघृततक्रग्रहण<k2>अ-हरीत-पर्ण-शाक-पुष्प-फल-दुग्ध-दधि-घृत-तक्र-ग्रहण
{%a-harīta-parṇa-śāka-puṣpa-phala-dugdha-dadhi-ghṛta-takra-grahaṇa,%}¦
<div n="lb">similar to {%a-harītaka-śāka-puṣpa-grahaṇa%} and {%a-dugdha-dadhi-%}
<div n="lb">{%grahaṇa,%} etc. See {%Ep. Ind.,%} Vol. XXXI, p. 5.
<LEND>

<L>6878<pc>389<k1>अहस्तप्रक्षेपणीय<k2>अ-हस्त-प्रक्षेपणीय
{%a-hasta-prakṣepaṇīya%}¦ (EI 11, 23), same as a {%a-bhaṭa-praveśa,%}
<div n="lb">etc. Cf. {%samasta-rājakīyānām=a-hasta-prakṣepaṇīya.%}
<LEND>

<L>6879<pc>389<k1>अहिरण्यधान्यप्रणयप्रदेय<k2>अ-हिरण्य-धान्य-प्रणय-प्रदेय
{%a-hiraṇya-dhānya-praṇaya-pradeya%}¦ (EI 26), refers to the
<div n="lb">freedom of the gift land from the payment of revenue in cash,
<div n="lb">the king's grain share and the benevolence or emergency
<div n="lb">imposts. Cf. Prakrit {%a-hiraṇṇa-dhaṇṇa-ppaṇaya-ppadeya%} ({%Select-%}
<div n="lb">{%Inscriptions,%} pp. 408-09).
<LEND>
[Page-390+ 40]

<L>6880<pc>390<k1>अकरद<k2>अ-करद
{%a-karada%}¦ (EI 26), refers to the freedom of the donee of
<div n="lb">the gift land from paying taxes in general.
<LEND>

<L>6881<pc>390<k1>अकरदायिन्<k2>अ-करदायिन्
{%a-karadāyin%}¦ (EI 26, 27), same as {%a-karada.%}
<LEND>

<L>6882<pc>390<k1>अकरवातोत्तर<k2>अ-कर-वात्-ओत्तर
{%a-kara-vāt-ottara%}¦ (IE; EI 32), sometimes with {%āvāta, vāt-ādeya,%}
<div n="lb">{%bhūt-opātta-pratyāya,%} etc., in place of {%vāt-ottara;%} cf. {%sa-bhūta-vāta-%}
<div n="lb">(or {%pāta%}) {%-pratyāya,%} etc; ‘free from the collections resulting from
<div n="lb">storms (e. g. uprooted trees, fruits, etc.).’
<LEND>

<L>6883<pc>390<k1>अकरविष्टिकोञ्जल्ल<k2>अ-कर-विष्टि-कोञ्जल्ल
{%a-kara-viṣṭi-koñjalla%}¦ (IE), refers to the freedom of the donee
<div n="lb">of the gift land from the payment of taxes and the obligation to
<div n="lb">supply free labour and {%koñjalla (kāñji)%} to the king's labourers.
<div n="lb">Cf. {%Select Inscriptions,%} p. 439.
<LEND>

<L>6884<pc>390<k1>अखट्वाचुल्लकवैनाशिक<k2>अ-खट्वा-चुल्लक-वैनाशिक
{%a-khaṭvā-cullaka-vaināśika,%}¦ cf. Prakrit {%a-khaṭṭa-collaka-veṇe-%}
<div n="lb">{%sika%} (EI 26), refers to the freedom of the gift village from the
<div n="lb">obligation to supply cots, food and attendant or fuel to the
<div n="lb">touring royal officers on their visit or to the king or landlord
<div n="lb">on occasions. Cf. {%a-kūra-cullaka-vināśi-khaṭv-āvāsa,%} etc.
<LEND>

<L>6885<pc>390<k1>अकिञ्चित्कर<k2>अ-किञ्चित्-कर
{%a-kiñcit-kara,%}¦ ‘not to pay even a small amount as rent or
<div n="lb">tax’; epithet of gift land; same as {%a-kiñcit-pragrāhya.%} It has to
<div n="lb">be noted that sometimes a small amount of tax was fixed for
<div n="lb">the gift lands. Cf. {%kara-śāsana.%}
<LEND>

<L>6886<pc>390<k1>अकिञ्चित्करग्राह्य<k2>अ-किञ्चित्-कर-ग्राह्य
{%a-kiñcit-kara-grāhya%}¦ (EI 27), same as {%a-kiñcit-kara,%} etc.
<LEND>

<L>6887<pc>390<k1>अकिञ्चित्प्रग्राह्य<k2>अ-किञ्चित्-प्रग्राह्य
{%a-kiñcit-pragrāhya%}¦ (EI 29), refers to the freedom of the gift
<div n="lb">land from the payment of taxes and the obligation of supplying
<div n="lb">articles to the king or landlord on occasions and to the touring
<div n="lb">officers on their visit; same as {%a-kiñcit-kara,%} etc.
<LEND>

<L>6888<pc>390<k1>अकिञ्चित्प्रतिकर<k2>अ-किञ्चित्-प्रतिकर
{%a-kiñcit-pratikara%}¦ (EI 23), ‘[land] free from any yield
<div n="lb">of revenue’; cf. {%utpratikara.%} But {%pratikara%} also means
<div n="lb">‘compensation’.
<LEND>

<L>6889<pc>390<k1>अकूरचुल्लकवैनाशिखट्वावास<k2>अ-कूर-चुल्लक-वैनाशि-खट्व्-आवास
{%a-kūra-cullaka-vaināśi-khaṭv-āvāsa%}¦ (or {%ºsaṃvāsa%}), cf. {%a-kūra-%}
<div n="lb">{%yollaka-venesi-khaṭṭ-āvāsa%} (EI 26); refers to the freedom of the
<div n="lb">gift village from the obligation of supplying boiled or unboiled
<div n="lb">rice, pots or fire-places for cooking, attendant or fuel, cot and
<div n="lb">shelter to the king or landlord on occasions or to the touring
<div n="lb">officers on their visit; same as {%a-kūra-cullaka-vināśi-khaṭvā-saṃvāsa,%}
<div n="lb">etc. See {%sāmant-āmātya-dūtānām=anyeṣām c=ābhyupāgame śayanīy-%}
<div n="lb">{%āsana-siddh-ānnaṃ na dāpayet%} ({%Ep. Ind.,%} Vol. XXX, p. 171).
<LEND>

<L>6890<pc>390<k1>अलवणगुडक्षोभ<k2>अ-लवण-गुड-क्षोभ
{%a-lavaṇa-guḍa-kṣobha%}¦ (EI 26), same as {%a-lavaṇa-khātaka,%}
<div n="lb">{%guḍa%} or sugar being added to {%lavaṇa%} or salt; cf. {%a-lavaṇa-klinna-%}
<div n="lb">{%khātaka.%}
<LEND>

<L>6891<pc>390<k1>अलवणखातक<k2>अ-लवण-खातक
{%a-lavaṇa-khātaka,%}¦ cf. Prakrit {%a-loṇa-khādaka%} (EI 7), refers
[Page-391+ 40]
<div n="lb">to the freedom of the gift land from being dug out or its trees
<div n="lb">being pierced for salt.
<LEND>

<L>6892<pc>391<k1>अलवणक्लिन्नखनक<k2>अ-लवण-क्लिन्न-खनक
{%a-lavaṇa-klinna-khanaka%}¦ (EI 26), same as {%a-lavaṇa-klinna-%}
<div n="lb">{%kreṇi-khanaka.%}
<LEND>

<L>6893<pc>391<k1>अलवणक्लिन्नखातक<k2>अ-लवण-क्लिन्न-खातक
{%a-lavaṇa-klinna-khātaka,%}¦ same as {%a-lavaṇa-khātaka, klinna,%}
<div n="lb">sometimes wrongly spelt {%kliṇva,%} probably, ‘toddy, sugar, etc.’
<div n="lb">being added to {%lavaṇa%} or salt. Cf. {%a-lavaṇa-guḍa-kṣobha, a-lavaṇa-%}
<div n="lb">{%klinna-kreṇi-khanaka,%} etc. Cf. {%Select Inscriptions,%} p. 408.
<LEND>

<L>6894<pc>391<k1>अलवणक्लिण्वक्रेणिखनक<k2>अ-लवण-क्लिण्व(न्न)-क्रेणि-खनक
{%a-lavaṇa-kliṇva(nna)-kreṇi-khanaka%}¦ (EI 26, 27), same as {%a-%}
<div n="lb">{%lavaṇa-klinna-khātaka.%}
<LEND>

<L>6895<pc>391<k1>अलवणक्रेणिखनक<k2>अ-लवण-क्रेणि-खनक
{%a-lavaṇa-kreṇi-khanaka%}¦ (EI 23), same as {%a-lavaṇa-klinna-%}
<div n="lb">{%khātaka.%}
<LEND>

<L>6896<pc>391<k1>अलेखनीप्रवेशतया<k2>अ-लेखनी-प्रवेशतया
{%a-lekhanī-praveśatayā%}¦ (EI 29), probably refers to the absence
<div n="lb">of the right to re-grant the gift land to any other party on the
<div n="lb">part of the king and to alienate the gift land on the part of the
<div n="lb">donee; {%lekhanī-praveśa%} may mean that the gift land should not
<div n="lb">be made the subject of another document.
<LEND>

<L>6897<pc>391<k1>अनाच्छेद्य<k2>अनाच्छेद्य
{%anācchedya%}¦ ({%Ep. Ind.,%} Vol. XII, p. 267, note), ‘unresum-
<div n="lb">able’; but since {%anāhāra,%} ‘unresumable’, is sometimes used in the
<div n="lb">same context, probably, ‘uncurtailable’; epithet of gift land.
<LEND>

<L>6898<pc>391<k1>अनादेश्य<k2>अनादेश्य
{%anādeśya%}¦ (EI 12), same as {%anirdeśya.%}
<LEND>

<L>6899<pc>391<k1>अनाहार<k2>अनाहार
{%anāhāra,%}¦ ‘unresumable’ ({%Ind. Ep.,%} p. 395), cf. {%anācchedya.%}
<LEND>

<L>6900<pc>391<k1>अनङ्गुलिप्रक्षेपणीय<k2>अनङ्गुलि-प्रक्षेपणीय
{%anaṅguli-prakṣepaṇīya%}¦ (EI 23), also called {%anaṅguli-prekṣaṇīya%}
<div n="lb">same as {%a-bhaṭa-praveśa,%} etc.
<LEND>

<L>6901<pc>391<k1>अनङ्गुलिप्रेक्षणीय<k2>अनङ्गुलि-प्रेक्षणीय
{%anaṅguli-prekṣaṇīya%}¦ (EI 23), same as {%anaṅguli-prakṣepaṇīya,%}
<div n="lb">{%a-bhaṭa-praveśa,%} etc.
<LEND>

<L>6902<pc>391<k1>अनासेध्य<k2>अनासेध्य
{%anāsedhya%}¦ ({%Ep. Ind.,%} Vol. II, p. 267, note 4), refers to
<div n="lb">the freedom of the people associated with the gift land from
<div n="lb">legal restraints.
<LEND>

<L>6903<pc>391<k1>अनवमर्श्य<k2>अनवमर्श्य
{%anavamarśya,%}¦ refers to the freedom of the gift land from
<div n="lb">troubles associated with the visit of royal agents. Cf. Prakrit
<div n="lb">{%anomasa%} ({%Select Inscriptions,%} pp. 192, 194).
<LEND>

<L>6904<pc>391<k1>अपारम्पर<k2>अ-पारम्पर
{%a-pārampara,%}¦ same as {%a-paramparā-balīvarda%} or {%a-paraṃ-%}
<div n="lb">{%parā-balīvarda-grahaṇa,%} a privilege of the donee of rent-free land
<div n="lb">({%Ep. Ind.,%} Vol. XV, p. 42).
<LEND>

<L>6905<pc>391<k1>अपरम्पराबलीवर्द<k2>अ-परम्परा-बलीवर्द
{%a-paramparā-balīvarda%}¦ (SITI), refers to the freedom of the
<div n="lb">gift village from the supply of bullocks primarily for the con-
<div n="lb">veyance of royal officers on tour.
<LEND>

<L>6906<pc>391<k1>अपरम्पराबलीवर्दग्रहण<k2>अ-परम्परा-बलीवर्द-ग्रहण
{%a-paramparā-balīvarda-grahaṇa%}¦ (EI 26), same as {%a-pāram-%}
<div n="lb">{%para,%} etc.
<LEND>
[Page-392+ 40]

<L>6907<pc>392<k1>अपरम्परागोबलीवर्द<k2>अ-परम्परा-गो-बलीवर्द
{%a-paramparā-go-balīvarda%}¦ (EI 22, 26, 27), same as {%a-pāram-%}
<div n="lb">{%para,%} etc., in which {%go%} (cow) has been added to {%balīvarda%} (bullock).
<LEND>

<L>6908<pc>392<k1>अपरिपन्थ्य<k2>अ-परिपन्थ्य
{%a-paripanthya,%}¦ ‘without opposition’; cf. {%Ind. Ep.,%} p. 394.
<LEND>

<L>6909<pc>392<k1>अपशुमेध्य<k2>अ-पशु-मेध्य
{%a-paśu-medhya%}¦ ({%Select Inscriptions,%} p. 414), refers to the
<div n="lb">freedom from the supply of animals for sacrifice.
<LEND>

<L>6910<pc>392<k1>अप्रावेश्य<k2>अ-प्रावेश्य
{%a-prāveśya,%}¦ refers to the freedom of the gift land from the
<div n="lb">entry of royal agents; same as {%a-bhaṭa-praveśa,%} etc. Cf. Prakrit
<div n="lb">{%a-pāvesa%} ({%Select Inscriptions,%} pp. 192, 194).
<LEND>

<L>6911<pc>392<k1>अपुष्पक्षीरग्रहण<k2>अ-पुष्प-क्षीर-ग्रहण
{%a-puṣpa-kṣīra-grahaṇa%}¦ (EI 26), same as {%a-puṣpa-kṣīra-san-%}
<div n="lb">{%doha,%} etc.
<LEND>

<L>6912<pc>392<k1>अपुष्पक्षीरग्रहणीय<k2>अ-पुष्प-क्षीर-ग्रहणीय
{%a-puṣpa-kṣīra-grahaṇīya,%}¦ refers to the freedom of the gift
<div n="lb">land from the supply, of flowers and milk to the king or land-
<div n="lb">lord on occasions or to the touring officers on their visit; same
<div n="lb">as {%a-puṣpa-kṣīra-sandoha,%} etc. Cf. Prakrit {%a-puppha-kkhīra-gahaṇi%}
<div n="lb">({%Select Inscriptions,%} p. 409).
<LEND>

<L>6913<pc>392<k1>अपुष्पक्षीरसन्दोह<k2>अ-पुष्प-क्षीर-सन्दोह
{%a-puṣpa-kṣīra-sandoha%}¦ (EI 26, 27), same as {%a-puṣpa-kṣīra-%}
<div n="lb">{%grahaṇīya,%} etc.
<LEND>

<L>6914<pc>392<k1>अपुत्रधनं<k2>अपुत्र-धनं नास्ति
{%aputra-dhanaṃ nāsti,%}¦ ‘there is no confiscation, by the king,
<div n="lb">of the property of persons dying without a son’; cf. {%aputrā-sahita,%}
<div n="lb">etc. Cf. {%Ep. Ind.,%} Vol. XXV, p. 237.
<LEND>

<L>6915<pc>392<k1>अपुत्रासहित<k2>अपुत्रा-सहित
{%aputrā-sahita%}¦ (IE), ‘together with the right to confiscate
<div n="lb">the property of persons dying without leaving any son’; epithet
<div n="lb">of gift village. Cf. {%aputra-dhanaṃ nāsti.%}
<LEND>

<L>6916<pc>392<k1>अराष्ट्रसांविनयिक<k2>अ-राष्ट्र-सांविनयिक
{%a-rāṣṭra-sāṃvinayika%}¦ (EI 26), refers to the freedom of the
<div n="lb">gift land from the administrative control to which the district
<div n="lb">in which it was situated was subject. Cf. Prakrit {%a-raṭha-saṃ-%}
<div n="lb">{%vinayika%} ({%Select Inscriptions,%} pp. 92, 94). See {%bhoga-sambandha-%}
<div n="lb">{%nirvacanīya, grāma-nilaya-nāḍa-sarva-bādhā-parithāreṇa,%} etc.
<LEND>

<L>6917<pc>392<k1>असन्नरप्रवृत्तिविनिवृत्ताचार<k2>असन्-नर-प्रवृत्ति-विनिवृत्त्-आचार
{%asan-nara-pravṛtti-vinivṛtt-ācāra%}¦ ({%Ind., Ant.,%} Vol. XI p. 113,
<div n="lb">text lines 36-37), translated as ‘the established customs [of the
<div n="lb">gift land] are withheld from [injury by] the enterprise of
<div n="lb">wicked men.’
<LEND>

<L>6918<pc>392<k1>अष्टभागिक<k2>अष्ट-भागिक
{%aṣṭa-bhāgika,%}¦ ‘paying one-eighth of the produce [in place
<div n="lb">of the usual one-sixth]’. Cf. Prakrit {%aṭha-bhāgiya%} ({%Select Ins-%}
<div n="lb">{%criptions,%} p. 70).
<LEND>

<L>6919<pc>392<k1>अष्टभोगतेजःस्वाम्यदण्डशुल्कयुक्त<k2>अष्टभोग-तेजःस्वाम्य-दण्डशुल्क-युक्त
{%aṣṭabhoga-tejaḥsvāmya-daṇḍaśulka-yukta%}¦ ({%Ind. Ant.,%} Vol XIX,
<div n="lb">p. 247, text line 102), mentioned along with {%nidhi-nikṣepa%}
<div n="lb">{%pāṣāṇ-ārām-ādi-catuṣprakāra-bīravaṇa-pārikh-āya-sahita.%} See {%aṣṭa-%}
<div n="lb">{%bhoga, tejaḥ-svāmya,%} etc.
<LEND>

<L>6920<pc>392<k1>अष्टादशजातिपरिहार<k2>अष्टादश-जाति-परिहार
{%aṣṭādaśa-jāti-parihāra,%}¦ the eighteen (i. e. all or various) kinds
[Page-393+ 40]
<div n="lb">of exemptions [usually enjoyed by rent-free holdings]. Cf.
<div n="lb">Prakrit {%aṭṭhārasa-jāti-parihāra%} ({%Select Inscriptions.,%} pp. 439-40).
<LEND>

<L>6921<pc>393<k1>अतृणकाष्ठग्रहण<k2>अ-तृण-काष्ठ-ग्रहण
{%a-tṛṇa-kāṣṭha-grahaṇa%}¦ (EI 26), refers to the freedom of
<div n="lb">the donee of the gift village from the supply of grass and fuel
<div n="lb">to the king or landlord on occasions or to the touring officers
<div n="lb">on their visit.
<LEND>

<L>6922<pc>393<k1>अवह<k2>अ-वह
{%a-vaha%}¦ (EI 26), refers to the freedom of the gift village
<div n="lb">from the obligation of carrying loads of the touring officers,
<div n="lb">etc., or of supplying a horse to them free of charges.
<LEND>

<L>6923<pc>393<k1>अवारसिद्धिक<k2>अ-वार-सिद्धिक
{%a-vāra-siddhika%}¦ (IE), refers to the freedom of the gift
<div n="lb">village from the obligation to supply unpaid labour in turn.
<div n="lb">Cf. {%a-cāra-siddhika.%}
<LEND>

<L>6924<pc>393<k1>भागभोगपशुहिरण्यकरशुल्क<k2>भाग-भोग-पशु-हिरण्य-कर-शुल्क
{%bhāga-bhoga-paśu-hiraṇya-kara-śulka%}¦ (EI 20), ‘together with
<div n="lb">[the right to] the share of the produce, periodical offerings,
<div n="lb">cattle or animals [for sacrificial purposes], tax in cash, tax in
<div n="lb">kind and tolls’.
<LEND>

<L>6925<pc>393<k1>भाविष्यत्कररहित<k2>भाविष्यत्-कर-रहित
{%bhāviṣyat-kara-rahita%}¦ ({%EI%} 24), ‘without all the taxes to be
<div n="lb">levied in future.’
<LEND>

<L>6926<pc>393<k1>भोगसम्बन्धनिर्वचनीय<k2>भोगसम्बन्ध-निर्वचनीय
{%bhogasambandha-nirvacanīya%}¦ (EI 12), ‘the relations [of
<div n="lb">the gift land] with the administrative unit (i. e. {%bhoga,%} to
<div n="lb">which it belonged) should not be reckoned [since the land is
<div n="lb">granted after separating it from the district] ({%bhogād=uddhṛtya%})’.
<div n="lb">Cf. {%a-rāṣṭra-sāṃvinayika, grāma-nilaya-nā ḍa-sarva-bādhā-parihāreṇa.%}
<LEND>

<L>6927<pc>393<k1>भूमिच्छिद्रनायेन<k2>भूमि-च्छिद्र-नायेन
{%bhūmi-cchidra-nāyena%}¦ or {%ºcchidra-pidhāna-vyāyena,%} ‘in accor-
<div n="lb">dance with the principle of cultivating the land for the first
<div n="lb">time and enjoying it free of taxes as a result’. The word {%chidra%}
<div n="lb">in the first means ‘cultivation’ and {%chidra-pidhāna%} in the second
<div n="lb">‘reclamation of uncultivable land for the first time.’ Some-
<div n="lb">times {%vidhāna%} is wrongly used for {%pidhāna.%} See {%Ind. Ep.,%} pp. 397-98.
<LEND>

<L>6928<pc>393<k1>भूतभविष्यद्वर्तमाननिःशेषादात्यसहित<k2>भूत-भविष्यद्-वर्तमान-निःशेष्-आदात्य-सहित
{%bhūta-bhaviṣyad-vartamāna-niḥśeṣ-ādātya-sahita,%}¦ ‘together with
<div n="lb">the arrears of taxes and with the present and future taxes in
<div n="lb">their entirety’; epithet of gift village. Cf. {%Ind. Ep.,%} p. 395.
<LEND>

<L>6929<pc>393<k1>चन्द्रार्ककालिकं<k2>चन्द्र्-आर्क-कालिकं शुल्कम्=आदेयं समस्त-राज्ये न्=आस्ति
{%candr-ārka-kālikaṃ śulkam=ādeyaṃ samasta-rājye n=āsti,%}¦
<div n="lb">‘there is no collection of tolls in the whole kingdom as long as the
<div n="lb">moon and the sun exist’. Cf. {%Ep. Ind.,%} Vol. XXV, p. 237.
<LEND>

<L>6930<pc>393<k1>चन्द्रार्कस्थितिकालं<k2>चन्द्र्-आर्क-स्थिति-कालं यावत्
{%candr-ārka-sthiti-kālaṃ yāvat,%}¦ ‘as long as the moon and sun
<div n="lb">endure ({%Ep. Ind.,%} Vol. XXXV, p. 135, text lines 21-22); some-
<div n="lb">times {%candr-ārka-ksitiº, candr-ārk-ārṇāva-kṣīti-sarit-parvataº,%} etc.
<LEND>

<L>6931<pc>393<k1>चलुःसीमावच्छिन्न<k2>चलुः-सीम्-आवच्छिन्न
{%caluḥ-sīm-āvacchinna,%}¦ same as {%sva-sīm-āvachinna, catur-aghāṭa-%}
<div n="lb">{%viśuddha,%} etc. Cf. Majumdar, {%Ins. Beng.,%} Vol. III, p. 125.
<LEND>
[Page-394+ 40]

<L>6932<pc>394<k1>चतुःसीमा<k2>चतुः-सीमा यावत्
{%catuḥ-sīmā yāvat,%}¦ same as {%catuḥ-sīmā-paryanta,%} etc. Cf. {%Ind.%}
<div n="lb">{%Ep.,%} p. 402.
<LEND>

<L>6933<pc>394<k1>चतुराघाटविशुद्ध<k2>चतुर्-आघाट-विशुद्ध
{%catur-āghāṭa-viśuddha,%}¦ ‘with the boundaries well demarca-
<div n="lb">ted’; same as {%catuḥ-sīm-āvacchina,%} etc. Cf. {%Ind. Ep.,%} p. 396.
<LEND>

<L>6933.1<pc>394<k1>चतुराघाटान्तर्वर्तिजलपाषाणनिधिनिक्षेपशुल्कादिसर्वतेजःस्वाम्यसहित<k2>चतुर्-आघाट्-आन्तर्वर्ति-जल-पाषाण-निधि-निक्षेप-शुल्क्-आदि-सर्व-तेजःस्वाम्य-सहित
{%catur-āghāṭ-āntarvarti-jala-pāṣāṇa-nidhi-nikṣepa-śulk-ādi-sarva-tejaḥsvāmya-sahita%}¦
<div n="lb"> ({%Ep. Ind.,%} Vol. XXXIV, p. 40, text lines
<div n="lb">37-38). See {%tejaḥ-svāmya,%} etc.
<LEND>

<L>6934<pc>394<k1>चतुष्कण्टकविशुद्ध<k2>चतुष्-कण्टक-विशुद्ध
{%catuṣ-kaṇṭaka-viśuddha%}¦ (EI 23), cf. {%catur-āghāṭa-viśuddha;%}
<div n="lb">probably refers to the custom of demarcating a plot of land by
<div n="lb">planting thorny shrubs on the borders.
<LEND>

<L>6935<pc>394<k1>चौरवर्जम्<k2>चौर-वर्जम्
{%caura-varjam,%}¦ also quoted as {%cora-varjam, cora-daṇḍa-varjam,%}
<div n="lb">{%cora-rājāpathyakāri-varjam,%} etc.; according to some ‘with immu-
<div n="lb">nity from the police tax’, while others take it to be related to
<div n="lb">{%a-cāṭa-bhaṭa-praveśa%} and think that the policemen were prohi-
<div n="lb">bited from entering a gift village except in connection with the
<div n="lb">apprehension of criminals; may also mean ‘without any right
<div n="lb">to inflict punishment of thieves, etc., or to levy fines from
<div n="lb">thieves, etc.’ See {%CII,%} Vol. III, p. 109.
<LEND>

<L>6936<pc>394<k1>चोरदण्डवर्ज<k2>चोर-दण्ड-वर्ज
{%cora-daṇḍa-varja%}¦ (EI 27), same as {%caura-varja,%} etc.
<LEND>

<L>6937<pc>394<k1>चोरवर्ज<k2>चोर-वर्ज
{%cora-varja%}¦ (IE), ‘without the right to punish the thieves and to
<div n="lb">realise stolen articles’; cf. {%sa-caur-oddharaṇa.%} But see also {%cauravarjam.%}
<LEND>

<L>6938<pc>394<k1>देशमर्यादारुवणान्विल<k2>देश-मर्याद्-आरुवण्-आन्विल
{%deśa-maryād-āruvaṇ-ānvila%}¦ ({%Ind. Ant.%} Vol. XIX, p. 247, text
<div n="lb">line 103), refers to the right to levy the tax called {%āruvaṇa%}
<div n="lb">(Sanskrit {%ṣaṭ-paṇa%}) according to the local custom.
<LEND>

<L>6939<pc>394<k1>देवब्राह्मणभुक्तिवर्ज<k2>देव-ब्राह्मण-भुक्ति-वर्ज
{%deva-Brāhmaṇa-bhukti-varja%}¦ (EI 23, 30), ‘excluding the
<div n="lb">property of the gods (i. e. temples) and Brāhmaṇas’.
<LEND>

<L>6940<pc>394<k1>देवकुलपुष्करिण्याधिकं<k2>देवकुल-पुष्करिण्य्-आधिकं कारयित्वा
{%devakula-puṣkariṇy-ādhikaṃ kārayitvā,%}¦ refers to the right of
<div n="lb">the donee to build temples and excavate tanks in the gift land
<div n="lb">without the permission of the king or landlord as was necessary
<div n="lb">in the case of ordinary tenants. Cf. Majumdar, {%Ins. Beng.,%}
<div n="lb">Vol. III, p. 125.
<LEND>

<L>6941<pc>394<k1>गोगौडसमेत<k2>गो-गौड-समेत
{%go-gauḍa-sameta,%}¦ ‘together with the cattle and herdsmen
<div n="lb">[of state farms] or with the grazing tax’; epithet of gift village.
<div n="lb">{%Go-gauḍa%} may be the same as {%go-kara.%} Cf. {%Ind. Ep.,%} p. 402.
<LEND>

<L>6942<pc>394<k1>ग्रामनिलयनाडसर्वबाधापरिहारेण<k2>ग्राम-निलय-नाड-सर्व-बाधा-परिहारेण
{%grāma-nilaya-nāḍa-sarva-bādhā-parihāreṇa%}¦ (EI 9), ‘with the
<div n="lb">exemption of all troubles connected with [the administration
<div n="lb">of] the village, subdivision (literally, habitation) and district [in
<div n="lb">which the gift land is situated]’. Cf. {%a-rāṣṭra-sāṃvinayika,%} etc.
<LEND>

<L>6942.1<pc>394<k1>गृहावतरणहरितपक्वसस्येक्षुचारणलवनोपमर्दनरोचिकाचिटोलाग्रहणपीठकपीठिकाखट्वापहरणकाष्ठेन्धन<k2>गृह्-आवतरण-हरित-पक्व-सस्य्-एक्षु-चारण-लवन्-ओपमर्दन-रोचिका-चिटोला-ग्रहण-पीठक-पीठिका-खट्व्-आपहरण-काष्ठ्-एन्धन-
{%gṛh-āvataraṇa-harita-pakva-sasy-ekṣu-cāraṇa-lavan-opamardana-rocikā-ciṭolā-grahaṇa-pīṭhaka-pīṭhikā-khaṭv-āpaharaṇa-kāṣṭh-endhana-%}¦
<div n="lb">
[Page-395+ 40]
<div n="lb">{%ghāsa-bus-ādikaṃ na kenacit = [kartavyaṃ] pragrāhyaṃ [ca],%}
<div n="lb">‘no one should enter into the donce's house, should graze one's
<div n="lb">cattle on the green crops in his fields, should harvest the ripe
<div n="lb">crops in his fields, should crush his sugar-cane, should accept
<div n="lb">{%rocikā%} and {%ciṭolā%} from him, should take stools, seats and cots
<div n="lb">from him and should take wood, fuel, grass, chaff, etc., from
<div n="lb">him’. For {%gṛh-āvataraṇa,%} see {%umbara-bheda.%} Words like {%rocikā,%}
<div n="lb">{%ciṭolā,%} etc., are not intelligible, although they certainly refer
<div n="lb">to certain obligations or levies. Cf. {%Ind. Ep.,%} p. 394.
<LEND>

<L>6943<pc>395<k1>गुवाकनारिकेलादिकं<k2>गुवाक-नारिकेल्-आदिकं लग्गावयित्वा
{%guvāka-nārikel-ādikaṃ laggāvayitvā,%}¦ refers to the right of
<div n="lb">planting arecanut and coconut palms in the gift land without
<div n="lb">the permission of the king or landlord as was necessary in the
<div n="lb">case of ordinary tenants; cf. {%sa-guvāka-nārikela.%} Cf. Majum-
<div n="lb">dar, {%Ins. Beng.,%} Vol. III, p. 125.
<LEND>

<L>6943.1<pc>395<k1>हस्तिदण्डवरबलीवर्द<k2>हस्तिदण्ड-वरबलीवर्द-॥।
{%hastidaṇḍa-varabalīvarda-coṭāla-andhā(rthā?)ruvā-pratyandhā-%}¦
<div n="lb">{%(rthā?)ruvā-adattā-padātijīva-ahidaṇḍa-ānta(tu?)rāvaḍḍi-bandha-%}
<div n="lb">{%daṇḍa-vijayavandāpanā-mārgaṇika-prabhṛti-bhaviṣyat-kara-sahita,%} refers
<div n="lb">to the donee's right to enjoy various taxes the nature of some of
<div n="lb">which is doubtful. These include the tax for keeping elephants
<div n="lb">and prize bullocks, tax for the maintenance of the king's {%Padātis%}
<div n="lb">(footmen or {%Pāiks%}), tax on the professional snake-charmers,
<div n="lb">ransom in lieu of imprisonment, presents to be made to the
<div n="lb">king on his return from a victorious campaign and tax to be paid
<div n="lb">for using the road in the gift village for the transit of articles of
<div n="lb">merchandise. See the expressions separately as noticed above.
<div n="lb">See also {%suvarṇa-daṇḍa-ahidaṇḍa … %} below. Cf. {%Ind. Ep.,%} p. 401.
<LEND>

<L>6944<pc>395<k1>जनधनसहित<k2>जन-धन-सहित
{%jana-dhana-sahita%}¦ ({%Ep. Ind.,%} Vol. XXXV, p. 135), ‘to-
<div n="lb">gether with the tenants and revenue income [of the village]’;
<div n="lb">some as {%sa-jana-dhana.%}
<LEND>

<L>6945<pc>395<k1>कुशलतापूतहस्तोदकेन<k2>कुश-लता-पूत-हस्त्-ओदकेन
{%kuśa-latā-pūta-hast-odakena,%}¦ cf. {%udaka-pūrvam,%} etc. See {%Ind.%}
<div n="lb">{%Ep.,%} p. 395
<LEND>

<L>6946<pc>395<k1>महादोषविवर्जित<k2>महादोष-विवर्जित
{%mahādoṣa-vivarjita%}¦ (EI 23), ‘excluding fines for great
<div n="lb">crimes’; cf. {%doṣa%} and {%daṇḍa-doṣa%} (fines) noticed above.
<LEND>

<L>6947<pc>395<k1>मुक्तोपरिकर<k2>मुक्त्-ओपरिकर
{%mukt-oparikara%}¦ (EI 29), free from minor taxes or without
<div n="lb">freedom from them. Cf. {%s-oparikara.%}
<LEND>

<L>6948<pc>395<k1>नानावृक्षसमेत<k2>नाना-वृक्ष-समेत
{%nānā-vṛkṣa-sameta,%}¦ ‘together with the various trees’; epithet
<div n="lb">of gift village. Some of the trees not to be enjoyed by unpri-
<div n="lb">vileged tenants were mango, {%madhūka,%} jack, coconut, arecanut,
<div n="lb">palmyra palm, sīsu, tamarind tree, etc. But the group was
<div n="lb">different in different parts of the country. Cf. {%Ind. Ep.,%} p. 402.
<LEND>
[Page-396+ 40]

<L>6949<pc>396<k1>नवनिधानसहित<k2>नव-निधान-सहित
{%nava-nidhāna-sahita%}¦ (IA 11), probably, ‘with the taxes fixed
<div n="lb">afresh’, though {%nidhāna%} is often the same as {%nikṣepa%} (q. v.).
<LEND>

<L>6949.1<pc>396<k1>निधिनिक्षेपपाषाणारामादिचतुष्प्रकारबीरवणपारिखायसहित<k2>निधि-निक्षेप-पाषाण्-आराम्-आदि-चतुष्प्रकार-बीरवण-पारिख्-आय-सहित
{%nidhi-nikṣepa-pāṣāṇ-ārām-ādi-catuṣprakāra-bīravaṇa-pārikh-āya-sahita%}¦
<div n="lb"> ({%Ind. Int.,%} Vol. XIX, p. 247), mentioned along with
<div n="lb">{%aṣṭabhoga-tejassvāmy-daṇḍaśulka-yukta.%} See the expressions as sepa-
<div n="lb">rately noticed above.
<LEND>

<L>6950<pc>396<k1>निधिनिक्षेपापुत्रकधनदण्डोपजातकसहित<k2>निधि-निक्षेप्-आपुत्रकधन-दण्ड्-ओपजातक-सहित
{%nidhi-nikṣep-āputrakadhana-daṇḍ-opajātaka-sahita,%}¦ ‘together
<div n="lb">with the right to enjoy treasure-trove and the occasional finds
<div n="lb">and accumulations on the land and to confiscate the property
<div n="lb">of persons dying without leaving any son, and to enjoy the right
<div n="lb">to appropriate the income derived from fines’; epithet of gift
<div n="lb">village. Cf. {%Ind. Ep.,%} 406.
<LEND>

<L>6951<pc>396<k1>निधिनिक्षेपसहित<k2>निधि-निक्षेप-सहित
{%nidhi-nikṣepa-sahita,%}¦ see {%sa-vṛkṣamālā-nīdhi-nikṣepa-sahita.%}
<LEND>

<L>6952<pc>396<k1>निध्युपनिधिहस्तिदन्तव्याघ्रचर्मनानावनचरसमेत<k2>निध्य्-उपनिधि-हस्तिदन्त-व्याघ्रचर्म-नानावनचर-समेत
{%nidhy-upanidhi-hastidanta-vyāghracarma-nānāvanacara-sameta,%}¦
<div n="lb">refers to the right of the donee to treasure-troves, occasional
<div n="lb">finds or accumulations on the ground, elephants’ tusks, tiger's
<div n="lb">skin and certain prized animals without surrendering them
<div n="lb">to the king as ordinary tenants had to do; epithet of the gift
<div n="lb">village. Cf. {%Ind. Ep.,%} p. 402.
<LEND>

<L>6953<pc>396<k1>निषिद्धचाटभटप्रवेश<k2>निषिद्ध-चाट-भट-प्रवेश
{%niṣiddha-cāṭa-bhaṭa-praveśa%}¦ (EI 22), same as {%a-praveśa,%} etc.
<LEND>

<L>6954<pc>396<k1>परिहृतपङ्गोत्कोट<k2>परिहृत-पङ्ग्-ओत्कोट
{%parihṛta-paṅg-otkoṭa%}¦ (EI 33), ‘exempted from the levies
<div n="lb">called {%paṅga%} and {%utkoṭa%}’. See the words as separately noticed.
<LEND>

<L>6955<pc>396<k1>परिहृतसर्वपीड<k2>परिहृत-सर्व-पीड
{%parihṛta-sarva-pīḍa%}¦ (EI 27, 29), ‘free from all troubles’;
<div n="lb">same as {%sarva-pīḍā-varjita, sarva-bādhā-vivarjita,%} etc.
<LEND>

<L>6956<pc>396<k1>फलरतिक<k2>फलरतिक
{%phalaratika%}¦ ({%Ep. Ind.,%} Vol. XXXV, p. 135), refers pro-
<div n="lb">bably to the right to enjoy all kinds of fruits in the gift land with-
<div n="lb">out special permission that was necessary for ordinary tenants.
<LEND>

<L>6957<pc>396<k1>प्रसिद्धचतुःसीमावच्छिन्न<k2>प्रसिद्ध-चतुः-सीम्-आवच्छिन्न
{%prasiddha-catuḥ-sīm-āvacchinna,%}¦ ‘demarcated by the well-
<div n="lb">known boundaries on all the sides’; epithet of the gift land.
<div n="lb">Cf. {%catur-āghāṭa-viśuddha,%} etc. Cf. {%Ind. Ep.,%} p. 402.
<LEND>

<L>6958<pc>396<k1>प्रतिषिद्धचाटभटप्रवेश<k2>प्रतिषिद्ध-चाट-भट-प्रवेश
{%pratiṣiddha-cāṭa-bhaṭa-praveśa%}¦ (EI 23, 27), same as {%a-%}
<div n="lb">{%praveśa,%} etc.
<LEND>

<L>6959<pc>396<k1>प्रतिषिद्धचाटादिप्रवेश<k2>प्रतिषिद्ध-चाट्-आदि-प्रवेश
{%pratiṣiddha-cāṭ-ādi-praveśa%}¦ ({%I. E.,%} p. 395), same as {%a-praveśa,%} etc.
<LEND>

<L>6960<pc>396<k1>पूर्वभुज्यमानदेवब्राह्मणक्षेत्रखण्डलकं<k2>पूर्व-भुज्यमान-देव-ब्राह्मण-क्षेत्र-खण्डलकं वर्जयित्वा
{%pūrva-bhujyamāna-deva-brāhmaṇa-kṣetra-khaṇḍalakaṃ varjayitvā%}¦
<div n="lb">(or {%vihāya%}), see {%Ep. Ind.,%} Vol. XXXV, p. 135; same as {%deva-%}
<div n="lb">{%brāhmaṇa-bhukti-varja,%} etc. Cf. {%Ind. Ep.,%} p. 398.
<LEND>

<L>6961<pc>396<k1>पूर्वभुक्तकभुज्यमानदेवब्रह्मदायवर्जित<k2>पूर्व-भुक्तक-भुज्यमान-देव-ब्रह्म-दाय-वर्जित
{%pūrva-bhuktaka-bhujyamāna-deva-brahma-dāya-varjita%}¦ (EI 23),
<div n="lb">same as {%deva-brāhmaṇa-bhukti-varja,%} etc.
<LEND>

<L>6962<pc>396<k1>पूर्वप्रत्तदेवब्रह्मदेयरहित<k2>पूर्व-प्रत्त-देव-ब्रह्म-देय-रहित
{%pūrva-pratta-deva-brahma-deya-rahita,%}¦ sometimes with {%dāya%} in
<div n="lb">place of {%deya;%} refers to the absence of the donee's right to have
[Page-397+ 40]
<div n="lb">any control over that land in the gift village which was already
<div n="lb">a rent-free holding in the possession of gods or Brāhmaṇas;
<div n="lb">same as {%deva-brahmaṇa-bhukti-varja,%} etc. Cf. {%Ind. Ep.,%} p. 398.
<LEND>

<L>6963<pc>397<k1>पुत्रपौत्रादिसन्ततिक्रमेण<k2>पुत्र-पौत्रादि-सन्तति-क्रमेण
{%putra-pautrādi-santati-krameṇa,%}¦ same as {%putra-pautr-ānvaya-kram-%}
<div n="lb">{%opabhogya,%} etc. Cf. {%Ind. Ep.,%} p. 399.
<LEND>

<L>6964<pc>397<k1>पुत्रपौत्राद्यन्वयोपभोगा<k2>पुत्र-पौत्र्-आद्य्-अन्वय्-ओपभोगा, ºआनुगमिनी
{%putra-pautr-ādy-anvay-opabhogā, ºānugaminī,%}¦ etc.; same as
<div n="lb">{%putra-pautr-ānugamaka.%} Cf. {%Ind. Ep.,%} pp. 394-95.
<LEND>

<L>6965<pc>397<k1>पुत्रपौत्रानुगमक<k2>पुत्र-पौत्र्-आनुगमक
{%putra-pautr-ānugamaka,%}¦ ‘the donce's right of enjoying the gift
<div n="lb">land should pass on to his sons and grandsons’; epithet of gift land;
<div n="lb">same as {%putra-pautr-ānvaya-kram-opabhogya,%} etc. Cf. {%Ind. Ep.,%} p. 392.
<LEND>

<L>6966<pc>397<k1>पुत्रपौत्रान्वयक्रमोपभोग्य<k2>पुत्र-पौत्र्-आन्वय-क्रम्-ओपभोग्य
{%putra-pautr-ānvaya-kram-opabhogya,%}¦ refers to the permanent
<div n="lb">nature of a gift of land to be enjoyed by the donee as well as
<div n="lb">his descendants; same as {%putra-putr-ānugamaka%} ({%I.E.,%} p. 398).
<LEND>

<L>6967<pc>397<k1>राजभाव्यसर्वप्रत्यायसमेत<k2>राज-भाव्य-सर्व-प्रत्याय-समेत
{%rāja-bhāvya-sarva-pratyāya-sameta%}¦ (EI 23), {%bhāvya%} being
<div n="lb">often changed to {%ābhāvya;%} same as {%a-kiñcit-pragrāhya,%} etc.
<LEND>

<L>6968<pc>397<k1>राजग्राह्यसमस्तप्रत्यायसमन्वित<k2>राज-ग्राह्य-समस्त-प्रत्याय-समन्वित
{%rāja-grāhya-samasta-pratyāya-samanvita%}¦ (EI 22), same as
<div n="lb">{%a-kiñcit-pragrāhya,%} etc.
<LEND>

<L>6969<pc>397<k1>राजराजपुरुषैर्<k2>राज-राजपुरुषैर्=अप्य्=अनङ्गुलि-निर्देश्यम्
{%rāja-rājapuruṣair=apy=anaṅguli-nirdeśyam,%}¦ same as {%srava-%}
<div n="lb">{%rāja-kīyānām=a-hasta-prakṣepaṇīyaḥ,%} etc. Cf. {%Ind. Ep.,%} p. 400.
<LEND>

<L>6970<pc>397<k1>राजसेवकानां<k2>राजसेवकानां वसतिदण्ड-प्रयाणदण्डौ न स्तः
{%rājasevakānāṃ vasatidaṇḍa-prayāṇadaṇḍau na staḥ,%}¦ refers to
<div n="lb">the freedom of the gift village from the obligation to provide
<div n="lb">accommodation and conveyance, etc., to the royal officers on
<div n="lb">tour; cf. {%a-kūra-chullaka-vināśi-khaṭv-āvāsa, a-paraṃparā-balīvarda,%}
<div n="lb">etc. See {%CII,%} Vol. III, p. 98, note 2.
<LEND>

<L>6971<pc>397<k1>राज्ञाराजपुरुषैर्<k2>राज्ञा राजपुरुषैर्=अप्य्=अनङ्गुलि-प्रक्षेपणीय
{%rājñā rājapuruṣair=apy=anaṅguli-prakṣepaṇīya%}¦ ({%Ind., Ant.,%} Vol.
<div n="lb">XIX, p. 247, text lines 103-04), same as {%sarva-rājakīyānām=%}
<div n="lb">{%a-hasta-prakṣepaṇīyaḥ,%} etc.
<LEND>

<L>6972<pc>397<k1>रम्य<k2>रम्य
{%ramya%}¦ ({%Ep. Ind.,%} Vol. XXXV, p. 135), refers to the fact
<div n="lb">that the gift land had nothing unpleasant about it.
<LEND>

<L>6973<pc>397<k1>ऋणादायादिसम्बन्धवर्जित<k2>ऋण्-आदाय्-आदि-सम्बन्ध-वर्जित
{%ṛṇ-ādāy-ādi-sambandha-varjita%}¦ (EI 23), refers to the free-
<div n="lb">dom of the gift land from confiscation for the realisation of debts
<div n="lb">incurred by the donee.
<LEND>

<L>6974<pc>397<k1>सबाह्याभ्यन्तरादाय<k2>स-बाह्य्-आभ्यन्तर्-आदाय
{%sa-bāhy-ābhyantar-ādāya,%}¦ ‘together with the external and
<div n="lb">internal income or taxes to be paid to the state and to the
<div n="lb">village authorities’; epithet of the gift village; cf. {%abhyantara-%}
<div n="lb">{%siddhyā,%} etc. Cf. {%Ind. Ep.,%} p. 395.
<LEND>

<L>6975<pc>397<k1>सभोग<k2>स-भोग
{%sa-bhoga%}¦ (EI 27; IA 9), ‘together with the {%aṣṭa-bhoga%}’.
<LEND>

<L>6976<pc>397<k1>सभूतपातप्रत्याय<k2>स-भूत-पात-प्रत्याय
{%sa-bhūta-pāta-pratyāya%}¦ (CII 3), refers to the income from
<div n="lb">the gift land as a result of some action of nature's agencies.
<div n="lb">Sometimes {%vāta%} and {%āvāta%} are found for {%pāta%} probably in the
[Page-398+ 40]
<div n="lb">sense of ‘a storm’ (cf. {%udvāta%}) and also {%upātta,%} ‘realised’.
<LEND>

<L>6977<pc>398<k1>सभूतवातप्रत्याय<k2>स-भूत-वात-प्रत्याय
{%sa-bhūta-vāta-pratyāya%}¦ (EI 23), with {%pāta%} sometimes in
<div n="lb">place of {%vāta;%} ‘together with the income arising out of a change
<div n="lb">of the natural phenomena (such as due to earthquakes, storms,
<div n="lb">etc.)’; epithet of gift land.
<LEND>

<L>6978<pc>398<k1>सभूतोपात्तप्रत्याय<k2>स-भूत्-ओपात्त-प्रत्याय
{%sa-bhūt-opātta-pratyāya%}¦ (EI 23), same as {%sa-bhūta-vāta-pra-%}
<div n="lb">{%tyāya,%} etc. The word {%upātta%} means ‘realised’.
<LEND>

<L>6979<pc>398<k1>सचौरोद्धरण<k2>स-चौर्-ओद्धरण
{%sa-caur-oddharaṇa%}¦ (EI 12, 23, 29), ‘together with the right
<div n="lb">to punish thieves and recover stolen property or fines’; epithet
<div n="lb">of gift villages. Cf. {%caura-varja,%} etc.
<LEND>

<L>6980<pc>398<k1>सदण्डदोष<k2>स-दण्ड-दोष
{%sa-daṇḍa-doṣa%}¦ (EI 23), ‘together with [the right to] levy fines
<div n="lb">for crimes’; the meaning of {%doṣa%} is really doubtful in the context.
<LEND>

<L>6981<pc>398<k1>सदण्डनिग्रह<k2>स-दण्ड-निग्रह
{%sa-daṇḍa-nigraha%}¦ (EI 24), refers to the king's power to
<div n="lb">punish [culprits] by fines or corporal punishment.
<LEND>

<L>6982<pc>398<k1>सदशापचार<k2>स-दश्-आपचार
{%sa-daś-āpacāra,%}¦ same as {%sa-daś-āparādha;%} cf. {%Ind. Ep.,%}
<div n="lb">p. 397.
<LEND>

<L>6983<pc>398<k1>सदशापराध<k2>स-दश्-आपराध
{%sa-daś-āparādha%}¦ (EI 27), also quoted as {%sa-daś-āpacāra;%}
<div n="lb">‘together with the right to punish and realise fines for the ten
<div n="lb">offences (murder, theft, etc.)’; epithet of gift village; cf.
<div n="lb">{%sahya-daś-āparādha%} probably meaning that the crimes committed
<div n="lb">in the gift village should not be punished by the king.
<LEND>

<L>6984<pc>398<k1>सदेयमेय<k2>स-देय-मेय
{%sa-deya-meya%}¦ (EI 7), same as {%sa-dhānya-hiraṇy-ādeya,%} etc.
<LEND>

<L>6985<pc>398<k1>सधान्यहिरण्यादेय<k2>स-धान्य-हिरण्य्-आदेय
{%sa-dhānya-hiraṇy-ādeya%}¦ (EI 11, 12, 23; IA 9), ‘together
<div n="lb">with the king's grain share and taxes in cash’.
<LEND>

<L>6986<pc>398<k1>साधऊर्ध्व<k2>स्-आध-ऊर्ध्व
{%s-ādha-ūrdhva,%}¦ ‘together with what is [produced or found]
<div n="lb">below and above the ground’; epithet of gift land. Cf. {%Ind.%}
<div n="lb">{%Ep.,%} p. 395.
<LEND>

<L>6987<pc>398<k1>सागमनिरमप्रवेश<k2>स्-आगम-निरम-प्रवेश
{%s-āgama-nirama-praveśa,%}¦ ‘together with approaches, ingress
<div n="lb">and egress’; epithet of gift land. Cf. {%Ind. Ep.,%} p. 394.
<LEND>

<L>6988<pc>398<k1>सगर्तावस्कर<k2>स-गर्त्-आवस्कर
{%sa-gart-āvaskara%}¦ ({%Ep. Ind.,%} Vol. XXXV, p. 135), mentioned
<div n="lb">along with {%s-oṣara.%} The word {%avaskara%} (also {%avakara%}) probably
<div n="lb">means ‘a mound’.
<LEND>

<L>6989<pc>398<k1>सगर्तोषर<k2>स-गर्त्-ओषर
{%sa-gart-oṣara%}¦ (EI 27, 29), ‘together with pits and saline
<div n="lb">spots or barren lands’; epithet of gift village.
<LEND>

<L>6990<pc>398<k1>सगिरिगहननिधान<k2>स-गिरि-गहन-निधान
{%sa-giri-gahana-nidhāna%}¦ (EI 24), ‘together with hills, forests
<div n="lb">and deposits’. See also {%nidhāna%} noticed above.
<LEND>

<L>6991<pc>398<k1>सगोकुल<k2>स-गोकुल
{%sa-gokula,%}¦ ‘together with the cowpens’; epithet of gift
<div n="lb">village. Cf. {%Ind. Ep.,%} p. 395.
<LEND>

<L>6992<pc>398<k1>सगोप्रचार<k2>स-गोप्रचार
{%sa-gopracāra%}¦ (EI 12), ‘together with the pasture lands’.
<LEND>

<L>6993<pc>398<k1>सगुल्मलता<k2>स-गुल्म-लता
{%sa-gulma-latā%}¦ (EI 12), same as {%sa-gulma-latāka,%} etc.
<LEND>
[Page-399+ 40]

<L>6994<pc>399<k1>सगुल्मलताक<k2>स-गुल्म-लताक
{%sa-gulma-latāka,%}¦ ‘together with shrubs and creepers’; epithet
<div n="lb">of the gift land. Cf. {%Ind. Ep.,%} p. 402.

<L>6995<pc>399<k1>सगुवाकनारिकेर<k2>स-गुवाक-नारिकेर

<div n="lb">place of {%nārikera;%} ‘together with the arecanut and coconut
<div n="lb">palms’; epithet of gift land; see {%guvāka-nārikel-ādikaṃ laggāvayitvā.%}

<L>6996<pc>399<k1>सहट्टघट्टसतर<k2>स-हट्ट-घट्ट-स-तर
{%sa-haṭṭa-ghaṭṭa-sa-tara%}¦ (EI 22), ‘together with market-

<L>6997<pc>399<k1>सहिरण्यभागभोग<k2>स-हिरण्य-भाग-भोग

<L>6998<pc>399<k1>सहिरण्यभागभोगोपरिकरसर्वादायसमेत<k2>स-हिरण्य-भाग-भोग्-ओपरिकर-सर्व्-आदाय-समेत

<L>6999<pc>399<k1>सहिरण्यादान<k2>स-हिरण्य्-आदान

<div n="lb">privilege of the donee of rent-free and.

<L>7006<pc>399<k1>सझाटविटप<k2>स-झाट-विटप
{%sa-jhāṭa-viṭapa,%}¦ ‘together with bushes and shrubs (or
<div n="lb">branches)’.
<LEND>

<L>7007<pc>399<k1>सकरोत्कर<k2>स-कर्-ओत्कर
{%sa-kar-otkara%}¦ = Prakrit {%sa-kar-ukara%} (EI 7); refers to a piece
<div n="lb">of land granted with the donee's right to enjoy major and minor
<div n="lb">taxes; cf. {%s-odraṅga-s-oparikara%} and {%sa-kḷpt-opakḷpta,%} etc. See
<div n="lb">{%kar-otkara%} as noticed separately above; also cf. {%kāru-kara.%}
<LEND>

<L>7008<pc>399<k1>सखल्लौन्नत<k2>स-खल्ल-उन्नत=स-खल्ल्-ओन्नत
{%sa-khalla-unnata=sa-khall-onnata%}¦ (EI 12), ‘together with
<div n="lb">low and high lands’; epithet of gift land. {%Khalla%} is Oḏiyā
<div n="lb">{%khāl%} ‘low land’. Cf. {%sa-nimn-onnata.%}
<LEND>

<L>7009<pc>399<k1>सखण्डपालीय<k2>स-खण्डपालीय
{%sa-khaṇḍapālīya,%}¦ ‘together with the tax for the maintenance
<div n="lb">of the swordsmen’; epithet of gift village; cf. {%padāti-jivya,%}
<div n="lb">tax for the maintenance of {%Pāiks%} or footmen. Cf. {%Ind. Ep.,%} p. 402.
<LEND>

<L>7010<pc>399<k1>सखटविटप<k2>स-खट-विटप
{%sa-khaṭa-viṭapa%}¦ (EI 12), mistake for {%sa-jhāṭa-vitapa%} or {%sa-%}
<div n="lb">{%kheṭa-viṭapa.%}
<LEND>

<L>7011<pc>399<k1>सखेटघट्टनदीतरस्थानादिगुल्मक<k2>स-खेट-घट्ट-नदीतर-स्थान्-आदि-गुल्मक
{%sa-kheṭa-ghaṭṭa-nadītara-sthān-ādi-gulmaka%}¦ (EI 29), ‘to-
<div n="lb">gether with the military, police or customs outposts in the ham-
[Page-400+ 40]
<div n="lb">lets, landing places on the banks of rivers (or passes in the
<div n="lb">hilly tracts) and ferrying stations’; epithet of gift village.
<LEND>

<L>7012<pc>400<k1>सखेटविटप<k2>स-खेट-विटप
{%sa-kheṭa-viṭapa,%}¦ ‘together with outposts and bushes’;
<div n="lb">epithet of gift village. Cf. {%Ind. Ep.,%} p. 402.
<LEND>

<L>7013<pc>400<k1>सखिलनाल<k2>स-खिल-नाल
{%sa-khila-nāla,%}¦ ‘together with the fallow and cultivated
<div n="lb">lands’; epithet of gift village; same as {%sa-khila-polācya.%} See
<div n="lb">Majumdar, {%Ins. Beng.,%} Vol. III, p. 125.
<LEND>

<L>7014<pc>400<k1>सखिलपोलाच्य<k2>स-खिल-पोलाच्य
{%sa-khila-polācya,%}¦ ‘together with fallow and cultivated land’;
<div n="lb">same as {%sa-khila-nāla.%} Cf. {%Ind. Ep.,%} p. 394.
<LEND>

<L>7015<pc>400<k1>सखिलोपखिल<k2>स-खिल्-ओपखिल
{%sa-khil-opakhila,%}¦ ‘together with land which is fallow and
<div n="lb">partially fallow’. {%Pakhila%} in the same context is a mistake for
<div n="lb">{%upakhila.%}
<LEND>

<L>7016<pc>400<k1>सकॢप्त<k2>स-कॢप्त
{%sa-kḷpta%}¦ (EI 24), ‘together with the tax on permanent
<div n="lb">tenants or the fixed revenue’; same as {%s-odraṅga.%}
<LEND>

<L>7017<pc>400<k1>सकॢप्तोपकॢप्तक<k2>स-कॢप्त्-ओपकॢप्तक
{%sa-kḷpt-opakḷptaka%}¦ (EI 24, 27), refers to the freedom of the
<div n="lb">gift land from the payment of fixed taxes on permanent
<div n="lb">tenants as well as occasional taxes or taxes on temporary tenants;
<div n="lb">same as {%s-odraṅga-s-oparikara.%}
<LEND>

<L>7018<pc>400<k1>सकृतप्रान्त<k2>स-कृत-प्रान्त
{%sa-kṛta-prānta,%}¦ cf. Prakrit {%sa-kutu-ppanta%} (EI 26), ‘together
<div n="lb">with the demarcated boundaries’; epithet of the gift land.
<LEND>

<L>7019<pc>400<k1>सलवण<k2>स-लवण
{%sa-lavaṇa%}¦ (EI 12), ‘together with salt (i. e. the right to
<div n="lb">enjoy salt produced in the land). Cf. {%a-lavaṇa-khātaka,%} etc.

<L>7020<pc>400<k1>सलवणाकर<k2>स-लवण्-आकर

<L>7021<pc>400<k1>सलोहाद्याकर<k2>स-लोह्-आद्य्-आकर
{%sa-loh-ādy-ākara,%}¦ together with the mines of metals, etc.’;

<L>7022<pc>400<k1>सलोहलवणाकर<k2>स-लोह-लवण्-आकर

<L>7023<pc>400<k1>समधूकचूतवनवाटिकाविटपतृनयूतिगोचरपर्यन्त<k2>स-मधूक-चूत-वन-वाटिका-विटप-तृन-यूति-गोचर-पर्यन्त
{%sa-madhūka-cūta-vana-vāṭikā-viṭapa-tṛna-yūti-gocara-paryanta,%}¦
<div n="lb">‘together with the {%madhūka%} and mango trees, forests, gardens,
<div n="lb">bushes (or, branches), grass {%yūti%} (grass land) and including the
<div n="lb">pasture land’; cf. {%Ind. Ep.,%} p. 396. It is better to take {%sa-madhūka-%}
<div n="lb">{%cūṭa-vana-vāṭikā-viṭapa%} and {%tṛnayūti-gocara-paryanta%} separately.

<L>7024<pc>400<k1>समधूकाम्रवनवाटिकाविटपतृणयूतिगोचरपर्यन्त<k2>स-मधूक्-आम्र-वन-वाटिका-विटप-तृण-यूति-गोचर-पर्यन्त
{%sa-madhūk-āmra-vana-vāṭikā-viṭapa-tṛṇa-yūti-gocara-paryanta%}¦
<div n="lb">(EI 24), ‘together with the {%madhuka%} and mango trees, forests,
<div n="lb">gardens, shrubs and as far as and the grass {%yuli%} (grass land) and
<div n="lb">pasture lands’. See {%sa-madhūka-cūta … ,%} above.
<LEND>

<L>7025<pc>400<k1>समन्दिरप्राकार<k2>स-मन्दिर-प्राकार
{%sa-mandira-prākāra,%}¦ ‘together with temples and walls’;
<div n="lb">epithet of gift village. Cf. {%Ind. Ep.,%} p. 395.
[Page-401+ 40]
<div n="lb">trees and areas covered by jungles (or areas covered with mango
<div n="lb">and {%madhūka%} plantations)’; see {%Ind. Ep.,%} p. 402.
<LEND>

<L>7026<pc>401<k1>समञ्चमहाकरण<k2>स-मञ्च-महाकरण
{%sa-mañca-mahākaraṇa%}¦ (EI 26), ‘together with {%mañca%} (pro-
<div n="lb">bably, platforms for the collection of tolls) and {%mahākaraṇa%}
<div n="lb">(official documents)’; epithet of the gift land.
<LEND>

<L>7026.1<pc>401<k1>सामन्तामात्यदूतानाम्<k2>सामन्त्-आमात्य-दूतानाम्
{%sāmant-āmātya-dūtānām%}¦ {%= anyeṣām = c = ābhyupāgame śayanīy-%}
<div n="lb">{%āsana-siddhānnaṃ na dāpayet,%} refers to the obligation of the people
<div n="lb">to supply beds, seats and boiled or unboiled rice to feudatory
<div n="lb">rulers, ministers, messengers and others encamped in a
<div n="lb">village; see {%a-kūra-cullaka-vināśi-khaṭv-āvāsa,%} etc. See {%Ep. Ind.,%}
<div n="lb">Vol. XXX, p. 171.
<LEND>

<L>7027<pc>401<k1>समस्तभागभोगकरहिरण्यादिप्रत्यायसमेत<k2>समस्त-भाग-भोग-कर-हिरण्य्-आदि-प्रत्याय-समेत
{%samasta-bhāga-bhoga-kara-hiraṇy-ādi-pratyāya-sameta,%}¦ ‘together
<div n="lb">with all incomes including the king's grain share, the periodical
<div n="lb">offerings to be made to the king or landlord and to the touring
<div n="lb">officers, taxes in grains, taxes in cash, etc.’; epithet of gift
<div n="lb">land; same as {%sa-hiraṇya-bhāga-bhoga,%} etc. See {%Ind. Ep.,%} p. 397.
<LEND>

<L>7028<pc>401<k1>समस्तभागभोगकरहिरण्यादायसमेत<k2>समस्त-भाग-भोग-कर-हिरण्य्-आदाय-समेत
{%samasta-bhāga-bhoga-kara-hiraṇy-ādāya-sameta%}¦ (EI 23), same
<div n="lb">as {%sa-hiraṇya-bhāga-bhoga,%} etc.
<LEND>

<L>7029<pc>401<k1>समस्तराजकीयानाम्<k2>समस्त-राजकीयानाम् = अप्रवेश्य
{%samasta-rājakīyānām = apraveśya,%}¦ same as {%a-bhaṭa-praveśa, a-%}
<div n="lb">{%cāṭa-bhaṭa-praveśya, a-bhaṭa-cchātra-prāveśya,%} etc. ({%Ind. Ep.,%} p. 398).

<L>7093<pc>404<k1>ससाटविटप<k2>स-साट-विटप

<div n="lb">{%jhāṭa-viṭapa%} (q. v.).

<div n="lb">eighteen (i. e. all) kinds of tenants (i. e. tenants belonging
<div n="lb">to all the communities)’.

<L>7111<pc>405<k1>सीसूमधूकतालप्रभृतिनानावृक्षसमेत<k2>सीसू-मधूक-ताल-प्रभृति-नाना-वृक्ष-समेत

<L>7124.1<pc>406<k1>शुल्कदण्डदाण<k2>शुल्क-दण्ड-दाण-॥।
{%śulka-daṇḍa-dāṇa%}¦{%-kāruka-maulika-śrotra-nidhi-nikṣepa-jala-%}
<div n="lb">{%paṣāṇa-tejaḥ-svāmyam = ity-ādy-aṣṭa-bhoga-sahitam,%} ‘together with
<div n="lb">right to the enjoyment of the gift land in eight ways such as
<div n="lb">the rights to tolls, fines (or obligations), customs duties, taxes

<div n="lb">trove, occasional finds or deposits, fishing, quarrying and {%tejaḥ-%}
<div n="lb">{%svāmya%} (full authority arising out of ownership).’ See the various
<div n="lb">words as noticed above. Cf. {%Ind. Ep.,%} Vol. XXXII, p. 42.

<L>7125<pc>406<k1>सुपल्लिकापेत<k2>सु-पल्लिक्-आपेत
{%su-pallik-āpeta%}¦ ({%Ep. Ind.,%} Vol. XXXV, p. 139), same as
<div n="lb">{%sa-pallika.%}
<LEND>

<L>7125.1<pc>406<k1>सुवर्णदण्डअहिदण्ड<k2>सुवर्णदण्ड-अहिदण्ड-॥।
{%suvarṇadaṇḍa-ahidaṇḍa%}¦{%-vartmadaṇḍa-vandāpanā-vijayandāpanā-%}
<div n="lb">{%tṛṇodaka-śāsanārdhika-cara(vara ?)balīvarad-ārthāruvā-pratyarthāruvā-%}
<div n="lb">{%padātijīvya-ādattā-āturāvaḍḍi-bhaviṣyat-kar-ādi-sahita,%} refers to the
<div n="lb">right of the donee to levy various taxes, the nature of some of
<div n="lb">which is uncertain (see the different expressions as noticed above).
<div n="lb">These include tax on the goldsmiths and snake-charmers, tolls to
<div n="lb">be collected for using the road passing through the gift village for
<div n="lb">the transit of articles of merchandise, presents to be made to
<div n="lb">the king or landlord on occasions, especially on his return from
<div n="lb">a victorious campaign, etc. See {%hastidaṇḍa-varabalīvarda … %}
<div n="lb">above. Cf. {%Ind. Ep.,%} p. 402.
<LEND>

<L>7126<pc>406<k1>स्वच्छन्दोपभोगेन्<k2>स्वच्छन्द्-ओपभोगेन् = ओपभोक्तुम्

<div n="lb">donee to enjoy the gift land according to his own free will.
<div n="lb">Cf. {%Ind. Ep.,%} p. 399.

<L>7146<pc>408<k1>वातोडरीय<k2>वातोडरीय
{%vātoḍarīya%}¦ (EI 22), epithet of gift land; probably a cor-
<div n="lb">ruption of {%vāt-ottarīya;%} cf. {%sa-bhūta-vāt-ādeya,%} etc.
<LEND>

<L>7146.1<pc>408<k1>यथादीयमान<k2>यथादीयमान-॥।
{%yathādīyamāna%}¦-{%bhāgabhogakara-paravaṇikara-kūṭaka-prabhṛti-sa-%}
<div n="lb">{%mast-ādāya,%} sometimes with {%turuṣka-daṇḍa%} and {%kumāra-gady-%}
<div n="lb">{%āṇaka%} in place of {%kūṭaka,%} and {%hiraṇya, jalakara, gokara, nidhi-%}
<div n="lb">{%nikṣepa, yamali-kambali,%} etc., added to the list. {%Bhāga-bhoga-%}
<div n="lb">{%kara%} means ‘taxes in general together with the king's share
<div n="lb">of grains and the periodical offerings payable to him.’ For {%pravaṇi-%}
<div n="lb">{%kara, kūṭaka%} and {%yamalikambali,%} see the words as noticed above.
<div n="lb">{%Turuṣkadaṇḍa%} was a tax levied from the Muhammadan sub-
<div n="lb">jects or for the defence of the kingdom from Muhammadan
<div n="lb">attacks and {%Kumāra-gadyāṇa%} may be a tax of one {%gaḍyāṇa%} levied
<div n="lb">on the occasion of a prince's birth. {%Hiraṇya%} is ‘tax in cash’,
<div n="lb">{%jala-kara%} fishing tax, {%go-kara%} grazing tax, {%nidhi%} treasure-trove
<div n="lb">and {%nikṣepa%} valuables found or accumulated on the land. Cf.
<div n="lb">{%Ind. Ep.,%} p. 397.
<LEND>

<L>7147<pc>408<k1>यथाप्रदीयमानभागभोगहिरण्यादिक<k2>यथा-प्रदीयमान-भाग-भोग-हिरण्य्-आदिक
{%yathā-pradīyamāna-bhāga-bhoga-hiraṇy-ādika%}¦ (EI 23), ‘what-
<div n="lb">ever is payable as {%bhāga-bhoga, hiraṇya,%} etc.’ See the words
<div n="lb">as noticed separately; also {%yathā-samucita-bhāga-bhoga-kara-%}
<div n="lb">{%hiraṇy-ādi-sarva-rāja-bhāvya-pratyāya%} ({%Ind. Ep.,%} p. 394).
<LEND>

<L>7148<pc>408<k1>यथोत्पद्यमानभागभोगादिक<k2>यथ्-ओत्पद्यमान-भाग-भोग्-आदिक
{%yath-otpadyamāna-bhāga-bhog-ādika%}¦ (EI 23), ‘with the power
<div n="lb">to realise {%bhāga, bhoga,%} etc., whenever they become due.’ See
<div n="lb">the words as noticed separately above.
<LEND>
;
; APPENDIX II
;
[Page-409+ 36]

<div n="lb">to a king at the time of his coronation.

<div n="lb">payable for minting gold or metal into coins; cf. {%akkaśālai-vari.%}

{%taṟi-kkuṟai%}¦ (SITI), same as {%taṟi-ppuḍavai.%}

; APPENDIX III

<H>APPENDIX III
<>NAMES OF COINS, METAL WEIGHTS, etc.

<L>7539<pc>428<k1>अच्चु<k2>अच्चु
{%accu,%}¦ Tamil; name of a coin; money; tax or income.
<LEND>

<L>7540<pc>428<k1>आछु<k2>आछु
{%āchu,%}¦ same as {%āsu;%} cf. {%accu.%}
<LEND>

<L>7541<pc>428<k1>आड<k2>आड
{%āḍa,%}¦ also spelt {%aḍḍa;%} name of a coin; half of a {%fanam;%} cf.
<div n="lb">{%aḍḍaga%} and {%aḍḍuga.%}
<LEND>

<L>7542<pc>428<k1>अडतालीसगानी<k2>अडतालीस-गानी
{%aḍatālīsa-gānī,%}¦ 6 {%aṭha-gānīs%} or {%ṭaṅkas.%}
<LEND>

<L>7543<pc>428<k1>अड्ड<k2>अड्ड
{%aḍḍa,%}¦ same as {%aḍa%} (q. v.).
<LEND>

<L>7544<pc>428<k1>अड्डचिन्न<k2>अड्ड-चिन्न
{%aḍḍa-cinna,%}¦ cf. {%āḍa%} or {%aḍḍa%} and {%cinna%} or {%sinna.%}
<LEND>

<L>7545<pc>428<k1>अड्डग<k2>अड्डग
{%aḍḍaga,%}¦ also spelt {%aḍḍuga;%} same as {%āḍa, aḍḍa.%}
<LEND>

<L>7546<pc>428<k1>अड्डुग<k2>अड्डुग
{%aḍḍuga,%}¦ same as {%aḍḍaga.%}
<LEND>

<L>7547<pc>428<k1>अडिक्काशु<k2>अडि-क्काशु
{%aḍi-kkāśu,%}¦ ‘tax collected from the stall-keepers in the
<div n="lb">market’; see {%kāśu.%}
<LEND>

<L>7548<pc>428<k1>अडिमैक्काशु<k2>अडिमै-क्काशु

<div n="lb">coins of 37 or 38 grains being called {%drachma%} or {%hemi-drachma%} by

{%gadyāṇa,%}¦ a gold coin or weight; generally regarded as 48
<div n="lb">{%ratis%} (about 88 grains) in weight; sometimes called ‘the gold
<div n="lb">{%gadyāṇa%}’; sometimes regarded as a coin like a farthing, equal
<div n="lb">to (1/4) or (1/5) of the {%paikamu%} (q. v.); regarded in some places as
<div n="lb">equal to 20 {%vals,%} 8 {%māṣas%} or (1/2) {%tola.%}
<LEND>

<L>7751<pc>436<k1>पगोद<k2>पगोद
{%pagoda,%}¦ also called ‘star {%pagoda%}’; Anglicised form of the name
<div n="lb">of the gold coin called {%gadyāṇa, hūn (hon)%} or {%varāha;%} since the
<div n="lb">word {%pagoda%} also meant ‘a temple’, the coin seems to have been
<div n="lb">so named owing to the representation of a temple or a deity on
<div n="lb">it; {%pagoda%} may be a corruption of {%bhagavatī%} meaning ‘the mother-
<div n="lb">goddess’.

<HI>yūyaṃ jāgṛta sampratipādayi-
<>tum 132

; ADDITIONS AND CORRECTIONS

[Page556+ 35]
<H>Addenda et Corrigenda
<HI>N. B.--Misprints that may be more or less easily corrected
<>by the readers include (1) a few cases of {%ṛ%} written as {%ṛi%} (e. g.,
<>p. 388--{%bhṛta,%} p. 393--{%tṛṇa%}) and {%cha%} written for {%ca%} (p. 324,
<>line 3); (2) wrong use of capital and small letters at the
<>beginning of entries meant for indicating persons and objects
<>respectively; (3) entries put away from their proper places
<>(e. g., p. 10--{%agahara,%} p. 49--{%bhamāti%} and {%Bhāṇaka,%} p. 211--{%naṅga%}
<>and {%Nāṇī,%} p. 257--{%prāstarika-śreṇī,%} p. 412--{%aradu dogarāca-ppaṇṇu,%}
<>p. 433--{%jīrṇa-viśvamalla-priya%}), and (4) occasional omission of
<>diacritical marks in {%ā, ĕ, ŏ, ḍ, ṇ, ś, ṭ,%} etc.
<HI>Page 5, line 26--{%Read%}--mortgaged
<HI>Page 9--Add--{%ādya-stamba,%} ‘covered with original
<>shrubs’, i.e. yielding no revenue income,
<>never cultivated.
<HI>Page 11, line 17--Read--{%āgrahāyanī%}
<HI>Page 16--Add--{%ā-mā,%} abbreviation of {%ādya-māṣa%} (i. e.
<>the original {%māṣa%} of 5 {%ratis%}).
<HI>Page 26, line 27--Read--{%Ārakṣ-ādhikṛta.%}
<HI>Page 28, line 12--Read--{%Arhad-āyatana.%}
<HI>Page 35, line 14--{%Add%}--Cf. {%Bṛhad-aśvavāra.%}
<HI>Page, 35, line 23--{%Add%}--RE XIII of Aśoka seems to speak of
<>the {%Aṭavī%} or foresters as habitually criminal.
<HI>Page 35, lines 29ff.--Read--{%aṭha-gānī,%} a billon coin equal to
<>8 copper {%jitals%} and to (1/6) of a silver {%ṭaṅka.%}
<HI>Page 40, line 26--{%Add%}--Cf. also {%nivāta.%}
<HI>Page 44, line 13--{%Add%}--See {%vāhyāli.%}
<HI>Page 45-- Add--{%Balisādhaka,%} tax-collector (Ghoshal,
<>{%Ag. Syst.,%} p. 25).
<HI>Page 47, line 35--{%Add%}--Cf. {%pāga.%}
<HI>Page 48, line 13--{%Add%}--In {%bhoga-bhāga-dhānya-hiraṇya%} of the
<>Kurud plates ({%Ep. Ind.,%} Vol. XXXI, p.
<>264), we have probably to understand
<>{%dhānya-hiraṇya%} realised as {%bhoga-bhāga.%}
<HI>Page 48, line 36--{%Add%}--See {%pagoda.%}
[Page557+ 39]
<HI>Page 61 line 34--{%Ada%}--tenure of (1/20) of the revenue of an
<>area granted to the Brāhmaṇas.
<HI>Page 62--Add--{%Bṛhad-aśvavāra,%} a cavalry officer
<>(Tripathi, {%History of Kanauj,%} p. 137).
<HI>Page 64, line 35--{%Read%}--(1/20) of a rupee.
<HI>Page 71, line 8--Read--{%Cau.%}
<HI>Page 77--Add--{%daivaka;%} see {%rājaka-daivaka.%}
<HI>Page 80, line 4--{%Add%}--May also be {%Dāṇḍa (Dāṇḍanāyaka)%}
<>and {%Bhogika.%}
<HI>Page 88--. Add--{%deva-hala,%} same as {%deva-bhoga-hala;%} cf.
<>{%hala-nyāya, bhikṣu-hala.%} See {%Suc. Sat.,%} pp.
<>84, etc.
<HI>Page 91, line 7--Add--{%Bhoga-bhāga-dhānya-hiraṇya%} of the
<>Kurud plates ({%Ep. Ind.,%} Vol. XXXI, p.
<>264) probably means {%dhānya-hiraṇya%} realised
<>as {%bhoga-bhāga.%}
<HI>Page 91 line 38--Read--{%dhārā-datta.%}
<HI>Page 97--Add--{%Digvijayin,%} ‘the conqueror of the
<>quarters’; title of some rulers conventionally
<>claiming to have conquered the {%cakravarti-%}
<>{%kṣetra%} (q. v.).
<HI>Page 97 line 13--{%Add%}--It normally means ‘the conquest of
<>the quarters’, conventional claim of a
<>type of Indian rulers.
<HI>Page 101, line 2--Read--collection of revenue (cf. {%Rājatar.,%}
<>VII. 2010)
<HI>Page 101 line 12--{%Read%}--watch-station for the collection of
<>tolls
<HI>Page 101 line 15--Read--{%Audraṅgika.%}
<HI>Page 101 line--Add-{%dukra,%} (1/5) of a {%phadiyā.%}
<HI>Page 111, line 12--{%Read%}--EI 9.
<HI>Page 111, line 34-35--Read--{%gānī,%} cf. {%aṭha-gānī,%} a billon coin
<>equal to 8 copper {%jitals%} and to (1/6) of a
<>silver {%ṭaṅka.%}
<HI>Page 115, line 22--Read--{%ghaṭikā-sthāna.%}
<HI>Page 119, line 29--Read--{%go-yuthī.%}
<HI>Page 125--Add--{%hala-nyāya,%} custom followed in grant-
<>ing rent-free holdings; same as {%brahmadeya-%}
<>{%maryādā,%} etc.
[Page558+ 40]
<>Page 129, last line--{%Add%}--Also cf. {%suvarṇ-ādāya, svarṇ-āya.%}
<HI>Page 131, line 16--Read--{%indr-āsana.%}
<HI>Page 131 line 28--{%Add%}--Cf. {%Mahābhārata,%} XII, 103. 2: {%atr=āpy=%}
<>{%udāharant=īmam=itihāsaṃ purātanam |%}
<>{%Bṛhaspateś = ca saṃvādam=Indrasya ca Yudhiṣ-%}
<>{%ṭhira ||%}
<HI>Page 138, line 17--Add--{%Kaivarta-bhoga%} and {%Kaivarta-vṛtti%}
<>really mean the land enjoyed by the fisher-
<>men for their service, e. g., ferrying, supply
<>of fish and boats, etc.
<HI>Page 144, line 30--{%Add%}--Note that {%boḍi%} or {%voḍi%} is also the same
<>as Bengali {%buḏi%} which is (1/4) of a {%paṇa%} and is
<>equal to 20 cowrie-shells.
<HI>Page 150, line 31--{%Add%}--probably derived from Sanskrit {%karṣa.%}
<HI>Page 150 line 36--Read--{%nat-kāśu.%}
<HI>Page 151, line 38--{%Add%}--explained as ‘a commander of the
<>elephant force’ (Tripathi, {%History of Kanauj,%}
<>p. 137).
<HI>Page 158, line Add--{%kedāra,%} coin of the Kidāra-Kuṣāṇas
<>(Bhandarkar, {%Carm. Lect.,%} 1921, p. 205).
<HI>Page 158, line 12--Read--{%kliṇva-kreṇi%} (for {%klinna-kreṇi%})
<HI>Page 164, line 34--{%Add%}--Same as {%Senabova%} (q. v.).
<HI>Page 165, line 6--Read--{%Kulavārika.%}
<HI>Page 166, line 39--{%Read%}--occurs, {%for%}--occury.
<HI>Page 170--Add--{%laṅkā,%} islet in a river ({%Kākatīya-%}
<>{%saṃcika,%} No. 31).
<HI>Page 182, line 18--Read--{%Pañcāyat%} board.
<HI>Page 190, line 19--{%Read%}--IE 8-2
<HI>Page 197, line 6--Read--{%maṅgalikā.%}
<HI>Page 200, line 5--Read--{%marīci.%}
<HI>Page 216--Add--{%Nigrāhaka,%} tax-collector (Ghoshal,
<>{%Ag. Syst.,%} p. 25). cf. {%Koṭṭa-nigraha.%}
<HI>Page 220--Add--{%nivāta;%} see {%s-oṣar-āvaskara-sthāna-nivāta-%}
<>{%lavaṇ-ākara%} (EI 22); same as {%āvāta.%}
<HI>Page 228, line 3--{%Add%}--The expression {%pāli-ddhaya%} in Apa-
<>bhraṃśa is explained as ‘small flags’
<>({%Bhār. Vid.,%} Vol. XXV, p. 34).
<HI>Page 230, line 23--{%Add%}--Bengali {%pāñcālī%} is a kind of versified
<>composition so called probably because it
<>was originally sung either before the
[Page559+ 40]
<>members of the Pañcāyat board or at
<>puppet shows.
<HI>Page 232 Add--{%pañcāṅgula,%} impression the plam with
<>outstretched fingers dipped in sandal paste
<>or any such thing; also called {%Pañcāṅgulika.%}
<HI>Page 242, line 19--Read--religious teachers.
<HI>Page 244, Add--{%Pāṭīpati%} (Tripathi, {%History of Kanauj,%}
<>p. 137); cf. {%Pāṭyuparika.%}
<HI>Page 245, line 14--{%Read%}--IE 8-8.
<HI>Page 256, line 12--Read--{%Pranaptṛka%}
<HI>Page 257--Add--{%prasūti-śālā,%} maternity home ({%Kākatī-%}
<>{%yasaṃcika,%} No. 31).
<HI>Page 266, line 4--Read--{%Puraśreṣṭhin.%}
<HI>Page 268--Add--{%putra,%} cf. {%Kerala-putra,%} king of the
<>Keralas; {%Guhila-putra,%} descendant of Guhila.
<HI>Page 305, lines 3ff.--Read--{%ŞaŞghānī,%} billon coin of the Tughluq
<>Sulṯāns, equal to six copper {%jitals%} and
<>to (1/8) of a silver {%ṭaṅka;%} same as {%cha-gānī%} and
<>{%śāśukāni.%}
<HI>Page 308, last line--Read--{%Senaiy-aṅgādikaḻ%}
<HI>Page 310, line 28--Read--{%abhyantara-siddhi.%}
<HI>Page 312--Add--{%siṃhakara,%} ‘lion-tax’ (Ghoshal, {%HRS,%}
<>p. 232).
<HI>Page 331, last line--Read--{%Malik-us-Sair.%}
<HI>Page 340, line 31--Read--{%ṭī.%}
<HI>Page 342, line 3--Read--{%tīthi-śūdhi%}
<HI>Page 342, line 38--{%Read%}--EI 23.
<HI>Page 355--Add--{%utpratikara,%} same as {%apratikara%} ({%Ep.%}
<>{%Ind.,%} Vol. XIX, p. 54, line 10).
<HI>Page 356--Add--{%utthāpita,%} dedicated ({%E. I.,%} 16, p. 15).
<HI>Page 359, line 1--Read--{%vahni%} (IE 7-1-2, EI 33), ‘three’.
<HI>Page 359 line 7--{%Omit.%}
<HI>Page 362, line 38--{%Read%}--CII 3

<>(Sarma, {%Reḍḍi Kingdoms,%} pp. 466-67).
<HI>Page 381--Add--{%vṛndāvana,%} see {%bṛndāvana.%}
<HI>Page 382--Add--{%Vyantara,%} see {%Yakṣa.%}

<>the {%ghaṭī-yantra%} (q. v.); cf. {%Yāmakinī.%}
